story:
Nosebleed Studio är Sveriges främsta mangatecknarkollektiv

Vi är idag ett av bara två förlag som fortsätter ge ut manga på svenska. Vi har funnits sedan 2006 och har utvecklats från ett nätverk av serieskapare som tecknar svensk manga och gör lite egna seriefansin till ett ordentligt förlag med distribution till bokhandlar och bibliotek landet över!

Förra året hade vi en framgångsrik kampanj istället för Bokmässan under pandemin, och med denna sommarkampanj vill vi ge er en ny chans att köpa våra splitternya böcker till kampanjpriser!

Denna korta kampanj är alltså inte en insamling för att producera en specifik bok, utan mer en chans för er fans att tillsammans känna att ni "besöker" vår digitala monter. Här, under bara denna vecka, kan ni:

  • Köpa manga till specialpriser!
  • Få tag på snygga vykort, artprints och originalteckningar!
  • Hitta våra nyaste nyheter!

Vi kommer också ha ett gäng direktsända teckningssessioner och samtal på vår Youtube-kanal och även på Twitch, så att det verkligen känns som att ni får träffa oss, ställa frågor och se oss rita! Se schemat längre ner.

GDPR: I år kommer vår distributör StjärnDistribution sköta utskicken av böckerna till er, för snabb och smidig leverans. Därför godkänner du som backar denna kampanj att vi delar din adress till vår distributör endast för detta utskick och inget annat.

 

Tre rykande färska nyheter!

Vi släpper tre böcker på en och samma gång!

Och det är bara här som du kan köpa dem till superbra pris, billigare än någon annanstans!

Du kan även lägga till våra andra böcker som add-ons, så oroa dig inte om du har missat något! Alla gamla böcker finns också till specialpris. Se mer längre ner!

Nedan följer mer information om de böcker som vi släpper.

 

Talli – Månens dotter bok 2

Detta är fortsättningen på det populära high fantasy-äventyret. Vi får reda på mer om personerna som Talli reser med, både de motvilliga och de något mer villiga. Vi får även träffa ett nytt syskonpar som av någon anledning anfaller Talli ...? Och plötsligt orsakar Tallis magiska explosion så att hennes vänner trillar ner i avgrunden!

Vi lovar ett fartfyllt äventyr med härliga relationer att utforska! Har du missat Talli bok 1? Inga problem! Lägg till den som en add-on. Se mer längre ner.

 

GG – livet är ett dataspel lvl 1

Ny bokserie på Nosebleed Studio! Vi följer fyra tjejer som gör sig redo att installera nyaste expansionen på deras favorit-onlinespel. Men åh vad lång tid det tar att ladda ner allt ... Och när de vaknar upp på morgonen har spelets monster tagit sig in i verkligheten?!

En vackert tecknad serie om Gamer Girls i fullfärg! 

En perfekt bok för den där spelnörden du känner – eller kanske är det dig själv?

 

Nosebleed Studio lär dig teckna manga – Karaktärsdesign, nyutgåva med 52 extra sidor

Vår extremt populära lär dig teckna-bok är tillbaka – nu med ännu fler sidor och uppdaterade bilder! Du får ett ännu större referensbibliotek på kläder, poser, frisyrer, ögon och mer! Många av bilderna är nya, och en hel del sidor har fått extra bilder.

Dessutom har vi nu lagt in ännu mer djupgående instruktioner kring hur man ritar sådant som öron, ögonfransar, muskler, anatomi, och mer. De allra svåraste bitarna har fått ännu mer lätta förklaringar, så att nybörjaren får en ännu lättare introduktion. Samtidigt har vi lagt till nytt i de svårare områdena också – så oavsett vilken nivå du är på kommer du att upptäcka något nytt!

Om jag redan har den första utgåvan av boken, varför ska jag köpa denna? Den första utgåvan är också bra fortfarande, men denna nya har så mycket mer. 52 sidor är ordentligt mycket mer! Om det fanns något du hade svårt att förstå i förra utgåvan är det mycket möjligt att vi har utvecklat det i denna. Varför inte ge din gamla bok till någon du känner och köpa denna för att bli en ännu bättre mangatecknare?

 

Add-ons

Här ser du saker du kan lägga till, även här till superpriser! Har du missat Talli bok 1? Inga problem! Lägg till den som add-on!

 

Välj ett vykort på vissa perks

På vissa perks får du välja bland flera exklusiva vykort! På perks Åkallerskan, Spelnörden eller vissa addons får du välja mellan tre olika vykort beroende på om du valt Talli eller GG. På andra perks får du alla tre vykort och behöver inte välja!

GGs vackra vykort här:

Kolla in dessa tjusiga Talli-vykort:

På Mangatecknaren och vissa add-ons får du även ett artprint. Du får ett slumpmässigt valt artprint från en av studions medlemmar. De är i A5-storlek.

 

Originalteckningar

På en hel del perks får du även en svartvit originalteckning från någon i studion! Du kan välja en av våra karaktärer, men det är alltså inte en commission som i att vi kan teckna någon annan karaktär. Men du kan välja vem som ska göra teckningen och vilken karaktär du vill ha utav våra karaktärer! Vi erbjuder både A5 och A4 format i olika perks så kolla vilka du vill ha!

 

Livestreams

Här ser du ett schema på de som kommer att teckna live under kampanjen! Ett superbra tillfälle att prata med tecknarna från böckerna. Kom och häng eller sitt och rita med oss!

 

Torsdag 29/7 kl 19.00: Nosebleed Studio Panelsamtal, klicka här för länk.

Söndag 1/8 kl 19.00: Liveteckning med Elise Rosberg, klicka här för länk.

Tisdag 3/8 kl 19.00: Liveteckning med Sourya, klicka här för länk.

Torsdag 5/8 kl 19.00: Liveteckning med Magnolia "Toffuo" Winroth, klicka här för länk.

Söndag 8/8 kl 19.00: Liveteckning med Ilaria Gelli, klicka här för länk.

Tisdag 10/8 kl 19.00: Liveteckning med Viktor Engholm, klicka här för länk.

Onsdag 11/8 kl 19.00: Liveteckning med Natalia Batista, klicka här för länk.

 

Stretch goals

Om vi kommer upp i mer än den summan som vi har satt, så kommer fler fina grejor att låsas upp vid vissa summor! Här ser du vad som kan komma att hända:

 

Risker

Detta projekt är satt till "flexible funding". Det betyder att det inte finns någon riktig risk! Alla som lägger en beställning här kommer garanterat att få sina böcker och tillägg.

 

Känner du en mangaälskare?

Även om du inte kan bidra med pengar så kanske du känner en mangaälskare som skulle vilja se den här kampanjen? Sprid gärna kampanjen till dina vänner! Kampanjen är bara igång två veckor, så missa inte alla fina böcker till superpriser. Även våra gamla böcker kan köpas till superpris, som du ser ovan!

Tisdag 3/8 kl 19.00: Liveteckning med Sourya, klicka här för länk.
Torsdag 5/8 kl 19.00: Liveteckning med Magnolia "Toffuo" Winroth, klicka här för länk.
Söndag 8/8 kl 19.00: Liveteckning med Ilaria Gelli, klicka här för länk.
Tisdag 10/8 kl 19.00: Liveteckning med Viktor Engholm, klicka här för länk.
Onsdag 11/8 kl 19.00: Liveteckning med Natalia Batista, klicka här för länk.
 
Stretch goals
Om vi kommer upp i mer än den summan som vi har satt, så kommer fler fina grejor att låsas upp vid vissa summor! Här ser du vad som kan komma att hända:




 
Risker
Detta projekt är satt till "flexible funding". Det betyder att det inte finns någon riktig risk! Alla som lägger en beställning här kommer garanterat att få sina böcker och tillägg.
 
Känner du en mangaälskare?
Även om du inte kan bidra med pengar så kanske du känner en mangaälskare som skulle vilja se den här kampanjen? Sprid gärna kampanjen till dina vänner! Kampanjen är bara igång två veckor, så missa inte alla fina böcker till superpriser. Även våra gamla böcker kan köpas till superpris, som du ser ovan!

story:
A bit about me; A lot about Fear

Always striving to create and innovate during my artistic career, I created and launched zombieportraits.com in 2006. In the years since, I have ‘zombified’ over 10,000 people around the world. That endeavour reinforced in me what I had already believed...With passion, integrity, and motivation you can accomplish some pretty amazing things! That is why this project is fully completed and ready to come to life in print ready to be embraced by YOU, the fans I adore, and hold so dear to my heart. And so, I am reaching out via crowdfunding for your help, and support on this artistic journey! By backing this campaign, YOU WIELD the POWER to bring FEAR to LIFE... If you DARE!!!

"Scared is what you're feeling. Brave is what you are doing!" - Emma Donogue

Rob Sacchetto's Cape Fear: An Introduction to Fear and Other Stories

This campaign's primary focus is on the newly compiled 48-page Prequel, to my first Graphic Novel, Cape Fear: Power Struggle, originally printed through a crowdfunding campaign in 2011.

This compilation of short stories demonstrates Fear's power, and the HUGE role, this God plays in our lives... From cradle to grave!

Follow a child's journey through Fear, as He lurks around every corner, in 'The Route'.

Witness the futility of trying to master the God of Fear, in this modern day fable, 'In Fear'.

Understand there is no escape from the fate Fear assigns to you, as a man is confronted by his alter-ego in 'A Monster's Tale'.

Watch in horror, as Fear creates a cavalcade of chaos, turning a hero into a killer in this wartime 'EC'-style, short, 'Fearless Franky'. 

So, if you are a fan of anthologies, this is the comic for you. Four different stories, each done in a unique artistic style, written, drawn and even lettered by me. I wore every hat on this project and pride myself on my continued learning and growing in my field. 

Rob Sacchetto's Cape Fear: Power Struggle 2nd Print Edition

A long, long time ago, I wrote and illustrated what was going to be a four issue comic book mini-series. From there, I compiled this complete and complex story into one incredible 150-page Graphic Novel. Since its first print release, a decade ago,  every time I read that version, I had a desire to do some fine tuning to the overall design, and the lettering. 

When I decided to reprint Power Struggle to offer it along with the Prequel for those who had missed out, I figured that now was the time. Enter Andrea Sacchetto, to edit comic script, and revamp the lettering, to make this improved version!

So, to sum it up, on this project, I have worn almost every hat, and whether to get credit or blame, I feel this is my absolute best effort in all creative aspects of building a better comic!

How do we make this happen?!

From print costs for each book, including shipping from the manufacturer to me, to the cost of packaging, print costs for the Limited, Number, Signed and Laminated poster,  your contribution to this campaign ensure that we are able to get high quality products made, and delivered to your doorstep in a timely manner! 

What about those Perks?!

Well, the most exciting thing about what you get, is that every single product, and piece of art has been envisioned and created by me. Every concept, every line, every character and creature you encounter are unique to the art style I have spent decades honing. 

You not only get a one-time only Cape Fear poster, but you can also get an original sketch of mine on card stock, an original full page illustration INSIDE the Graphic Novel, a one of a kind, hand painted Zombie Portrait, by yours truly, or one of five ACTUAL art pages, that are part of the Cape Fear: Power Struggle book! 

AND, with conventions not up in swing yet, I will be autographing each piece that is sent out, as a Special thank you, and I MISS  YOU ALL!!! 

The way I do the things I do!

Well, if there is one unchanging truth about me and my work, I have never missed a deadline, nor folded on a funded project! In the past 15 years as a working artist, I launched an online business; zombieportraits.com, where my 'army of undead' Zombified fans now number over 10,000 customers worldwide!! To keep busy in my 'downtime', I have Zombiedaily.com, where, yep, I post a new Zombie drawing or painting daily since 2008. My work has been featured on  many products, and I have had two of my books published on a mass scale. Throughout the years, I have successfully funded Cape Fear Graphic Novel, Zombie Pin-Up Girls, Vol 1&2, Color this!, an adult Coloring book, and in 2019, the 'Color by Nature,' Calendar.

Other ways you can Help!

Hey, we all know the past year hasn't been easy... so, if you can't contribute, you can still help! Share this campaign on ALL YOUR SOCIAL MEDIA!!! Ever view counts!!!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Years after surviving the mysterious tragedy that led to the death of his crew, Gary recounts the events to a journalist, as the ship takes them back to the infamous shores of Longharbor , where it all happened. A journey between reality up above and the nightmares below the waves, in which men are just as cruel as the monsters they'll encounter.

 

To give you an idea of what the art in the book will look like here are some examples of Longharbor page art and concept art. 














 

 

Hi, I'm Alejandro Mirabal, creator of Longharbor.  I was once a diver for a maritime archaeological company, but now I'm a freelance concept artist. Check out my instagram  /  artstation / twitter to see the examples of my work. 

I've worked on a lot of high profile projects like  Magic: The Gathering, GWENT and I've also done work for Neill Blomkamp (director of District 9 & Elysium). Longharbor is a passion project of mine that I've been developing for a while. With your help I can finally make it a reality, so please consider supporting Longharbor.

 

25$ (+shipping) - If you just want a book then pick this option, and you'll get a physical copy of Longharbor with at least 70 pages of story (size of the story might be expanded as a stretch goal).

50$ (+shipping) - If you have money to spare and want to make sure we reach our goal then pick this and you not only get a physical copy of Longharbor but also an exclusive high-quality print (A3, ~12x16 inches).

500$ (+shipping) - This offer is COSTLY, and it's limited to only 10 people, but if you decide to be one of them then besides a physical copy of Longharbor and an exclusive high-quality print you'll also get a unique physical art-piece with a Longharbor-themed monster, drawn and signed by me just for you. 10 A4 drawings - 10 different monsters. Here's the example of traditional drawings done by me (these are just examples and aren't a part of the rewards):

These are the BASIC offers, but If we manage to reach our goal successfully, we will announce stretch goals aimed to add more value to each tier.

story:
SeaDog and Codename: Killswitch return in a new  48 page adventure from writer Mark Poulton (Graveyard Shift, Hawkman) and artist Clint Hilinski (Justice League, GI Joe, Pirate Queen)! After the events of Book I, SeaDog and the Killswitch team are hot on the trail of Shikari, who has taken refuge on the planet Tharune, homeworld of Killswitch member, StormBorn! 

SeaDog and Codename: Killswitch Book II features covers by Clint Hilinski and Dan Fraga (Black Flag)! In addition, Book I is available again featuring the black and white line art from Jon Malin's Book I Cover. 

In addition, the campaign features the Babe Box! Similar to the USAssassin Footlocker, the Babe Box features all of the books from both SeaDog and Codename: Killswitch Campaigns for a total of 5 books inside a collector's box with Rebel and Neon artwork on it. The box also includes sketches, trading cards and more! 

Clint Hilinski Book II Cover

Dan Fraga Cover inked by Shelby Robertson and colored by Matt Yackey (Black Flag)!

Book I Reprint featuring Jon Malin Line Art Variant Cover

Interior Pages by Clint Hilinski and Andrew Dalhouse

 

Interior pages by Clint Hilinski

 

Babe Box Collector's Case

SEADOG POPSOCKET now included in all BABE BOXES featuring artwork by Six AM Comics! 

STRETCH GOALS! 

$10,000 - 6X9 "Marvel Swimsuit Issue" Style mini-print of Neon

$15,000 - 6x9 "Marvel Swimsuit Issue" Style mini-print of Rebel

$23,000 - All backers receive an 8 page, black & white Viking Wolf ashcan preview book!

story:
ABOUT US

My brothers and I grew up with a great love of comic books long before their superhero concepts became mainstream.  That love is still there, and we believe comics are awesome!  The industry, however, has a lot of room for improvement. We feel that it is vitally important for quality independent books to be developed and supported.  Making comics isn't easy, but we had that creative itch to scratch, and we want to do our small part to contribute to and help revitalize the industry we love. 

As a result, we developed the TRIUMPHVERSE, our own inter-connected series of superhero-themed books that focuses on quality first -- always.

We previously self-published the CODENAME: BLACK DEATH mini-series, about a decorated veteran turned vigilante, as well as the successfully crowdfunded AGENTS OF TALON, which has been aptly described as 'GIJOE with heart.'

My brother and myself are excited to present to you the next title in the Triumphverse, DEVIL'S CLAW.

 

THE STORY

Every person is capable of great good - and great evil.  What if the Devil tempted you in your time of greatest need, to manipulate you into becoming a physical manifestation of his evil?  Could you control that evil, or would it consume you?

 

DEVIL'S CLAW (68 pages) was created and written by Mark and Steve Zinngrabe, with interior art by Rol Enriquez. All covers were digitally drawn by Scott Clark (Wildstorm, Marvel, DC), a true pioneer in digital art. 

Scott was an amazingly talented artist, and we were saddened to hear of his passing.   His collaboration on the covers for DEVIL'S CLAW took art into a revolutionary direction by him digitally drawing over his scanned pencils, and he breathed life into this character for the cover.

 

THE STORY

Devin Goodwell lost everything in life that mattered to him. To pick up the pieces of his shattered life, he turns to the church for guidance.  But grief still consumes him, and in his moment of weakness the Devil tempts him with the strength he so desperately desires. 

 

Devin discovers a nemesis in the notorious arms dealer Slick Puppy, the cold-blooded leader of the Pack. Slick Puppy’s own quest for revenge puts him on a collision course with Devin, which drives Devin over the edge—to become the Devil’s Claw.  However, his newfound strength will not come without a price.

 

Here are some pages of the book without lettering (all finish pages are fully lettered).

When the Devil's Claw has his sights set on you, will you survive?

A weakness is discovered..,

A rundown attempt meets an unexpected result...

Fear draws him in like a beacon...

Who is the mysterious Short Fuse that watches and waits for the right opportunity to strike?

​

Is there still good within Devin Goodwell? 

 


VARIOUS REWARDS

DEVIL'S CLAW VS SLICK PUPPY (VARIANT) BY SCOTT CLARK. AMAZING!

 

Available through crowdfunding only will be a limited print run of the individual DEVIL'S CLAW chapters printed as comic books #1-3.  Each of these rare birds has an original digital cover by Scott Clark.

 

RISKS

DEVIL'S CLAW is the first appearance and origin of Devil’s Claw and the third title in our connected "Triumphverse". Our goal is to print DEVIL'S CLAW and continue to grow and inter-connect the characters of the Triumphverse with well-written character-driven stories. 

Many crowdfunded comics get delayed due to artwork not being done.  Good news, the artwork on DEVIL'S CLAW is complete! 

Thank you for taking the time to read about our project! We feel that we've created something truly special and unique with DEVIL'S CLAW. After all the blood, sweat and tears (there definitely have been tears), this project is ready to rock. Your pledge means the world to us. It is a vote of support that will allow us to finally bring DEVIL'S CLAW to print, and allow us to continue to create great stories. Your support, no matter how big or small, is met with a heartfelt thank you and a desire to bring this book to you and exceed expectations.  

Please like and share on social media--every little bit counts!

Visit us at https://www.facebook.com/triumphverse

story:
Hello everyone, my name is Ana from Gavelock Studio.

I'm here to tell you about my first project on indiegogo.

Always loved to make up stories and to build worlds, but never got the time to really work on something like this again. But here it is, a passionate project!

What I love about stories is to make them fun to read and to have a solid cast of characters. What I wanted to try here is to add a bit of space exploration as I've had them in video games that I played. As someone who loves to read about Astronomy, there are a few things sprinkled here and there to make the world come to life.

I hope you enjoy my first project called GH-057 STORY: DOUBLE STARS.
 

Story Teaser:

Ghost's search for a crucial item called "Carabalt" within the current solar system is cut short when his ship suddenly gets attacked by someone familiar.
No way out of the situation, Ghost decides to emergency land on a nearby planet. But what he doesn't know is, that he collided with Mallory's travel pod, pulling her into the orbit as well.

Who or what is Ghost and why is his time limited to find the Carabalt?
What is Mallory now doing when her travels are disrupted and who is this creature who's stalking them?

Back this campaign and find out!

 

What are the specs?

  • Story and characters by Folkenstal
  • Art by Hoang Trong Thien from Light Comic Studio
  • The graphic novel has at least 110 pages
  • Has a few color pages in the beginning, but mainly black and white
  • page size is DIN A5
  • Shipping is FREE and WORLDWIDE!
  • First free pages are all the way down for you to read.

 

What's the plan for this project?

  • GH-057 STORY: DOUBLE STARS graphic novel is the first part of my story
  • I'll start working on the second one when the first campaign was a success
  • The story of graphic novel #2 is already roughly mapped out

 

Risk & Challenges

I'm aware that Indiegogo campaigns come with risks, but to be honest, the project will be done anyways. I've paid the artist to get it all started and will pay the rest as soon as the first half of the story is done, so no worries there.
I've a bit of experience in publishing books (not comic related) so the only thing that's new to me is to fund this with indiegogo instead of funding it all by myself.

Let us make this passionate project possible and give you a high-quality product! <3

 

Goodies

Also don't miss out on the playing card game 90-Nova that I made for the story!
There's a gym-bag and a blueprint of the ship THRACER available, too

 

Ways you can help to boost this

If you're not able to contribute, don't worry. You can always help!
Use the share tools and share it on your social media platforms.
Bring the story of GH-057 to the people.

Thank you for all of your support! <3

 

Meet the characters!

Ghost (GH-057)
Meet Ghost! A human-like creature who’s in search of a crucial material called “Carabalt”.
He keeps his cool most of the time and tries to stay out of conflicts during his mission. Being an outsider in an unknown territory he’d rather lay low.

Mallory Embers
Mallory leaves her polluted home planet to travel to planet Ellys, a promising new home for many people in her solar system. She’s optimistic and likes to develop and offer ideas when a problem appears. Mallory is curious to know more about the mysterious outsider who made her deviate from her travels.

 

 

 

 

 

FREE PAGES:
story_txt:
Hello everyone, my name is Ana from Gavelock Studio.I'm here to tell you about my first project on indiegogo.Always loved to make up stories and to build worlds, but never got the time to really work on something like this again. But here it is, a passionate project!What I love about stories is to make them fun to read and to have a solid cast of characters. What I wanted to try here is to add a bit of space exploration as I've had them in video games that I played. As someone who loves to read about Astronomy, there are a few things sprinkled here and there to make the world come to life.I hope you enjoy my first project called GH-057 STORY: DOUBLE STARS. Story Teaser:Ghost's search for a crucial item called "Carabalt" within the current solar system is cut short when his ship suddenly gets attacked by someone familiar.No way out of the situation, Ghost decides to emergency land on a nearby planet. But what he doesn't know is, that he collided with Mallory's travel pod, pulling her into the orbit as well.Who or what is Ghost and why is his time limited to find the Carabalt?What is Mallory now doing when her travels are disrupted and who is this creature who's stalking them?Back this campaign and find out! What are the specs?
Story and characters by Folkenstal
Art by Hoang Trong Thien from Light Comic Studio
The graphic novel has at least 110 pages

Has a few color pages in the beginning, but mainly black and white
page size is DIN A5
Shipping is FREE and WORLDWIDE!

First free pages are all the way down for you to read.

story:
TRIBULATION TASKFORCE # 1

The Apostle John is alive and being held prisoner at the Vatican. Being alerted of this, Grok assembles the Tribulation Taskforce to rescue him. Will they succeed? and of so, what will the consequences be?  Find out in TTF #1

24 pages of Superhero Fun!!!

 

What is the Tribulation Taskforce about?

The end of days are upon us!
​
The soon to come anti-christ is on a mission to bring forth the last days before the appointed time. Under a platform of world peace, he uses his position in the United Nations to assemble a team of Super powered warriors to help him achieve his true goal, the destruction of mankind.

God calls a young man named Hector (aka Grok)  to find the Apostle John, who is alive and being held captive at the Vatican. 

Together they will assemble the greatest Superhero force the world has ever seen.  
​They are   THE TRIBULATION TASKFORCE!

Who will like this series?

This is a classic superhero story! The heroes who triumphs over adversity! Full on superhero action of the classic Marvel and DC books! We are building a universe of Mature yet fun heroes!

Great for fans of:

  • Superhero Fun
  • Action Movies
  • Christian Adventure
  • Dragon Ball Z/My Hero Academia
  • X-Men

 

PACKAGES AVAILABLE FOR PURCHASE!

 

CAMPAIGN GOAL

The book is about 75% complete. The funds will help finish the book and create capital for the next 2 issues in the Tribulation Taskforce universe!  We are committed to bringing new adventures and characters for you to enjoy!

 

All rewards are scheduled to ship by October 2020 (possible sooner)

CREATORS

Writer/Creator: Bill Raupp

Artist: Olan Orig

Colors: Periya Pillai

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise on Social media!
  • Use the Indiegogo share buttons to spread the word!

story:
The sequel to 2018's IRON SIGHTS takes the franchise across the border into Mexico!

 

Esme is running her own cartel with Ramadi as one of her enforcers. Harm, a deep-cover operative recruited by Special Agent Woods for OPERATION MARGRAVE finds himself trapped in his undercover assignment after Woods' death. Add in a schizophrenic tourist, a depressed homicidal giant and two young people in love and you get...IRON SIGHTS: 2 PSYCHOS!

 

Why TELL you about this already-completed 100-page graphic novel and not just SHOW you the first 12 pages?

 

List of Creators

Story & Lettering by Richard C. Meyer

Interior Art by Ibai Canales

Cover/Poster by Kelsey Shannon

Esme poster by Sasha Perdigao

IRON SIGHTS logo by Bob Stone

 

If you missed out on the original IRON SIGHTS graphic novel, you have a chance to get it along with the sequel!

 

$100,000 STRETCH GOAL-  If this Stretch Goal is reached, ALL copies of IRON SIGHTS: 2 PSYCHOS will be signed by Richard C. Meyer!

story:
STRETCH GOALS!

WHO IS GEM MINT?


Gem Mint got his start on Instagram in 2014. He built a name for himself in the collecting community through buying and selling comic books. In 2017 he launched his YouTube channel to share his love of comics and collectibles. He has since gained 100,000 subscribers and amassed 15 million views. He specializes in statue unboxings, omnibus breakdowns, and weekly comic book reviews.

You can find the Gem Mint YouTube page here: 

 
 

A CHIP OFF THE OLD GEM

Those of you who watch Gem's fun videos know his daughter Jade is an artist. And we are thrilled to be able to offer this fresh new talent an opportunity to showcase her skills on the cover of this very cool special Red Sonja edition!  Jade's beautiful art is new school - drawn and colored digitally - and the end result is something really special!  

Jade Hope is a 16 year old aspiring artist from South Florida. She has been drawing traditionally since she was a child. A few years ago she got an iPad Pro from her father, Gem Mint, as a gift. Which she used to ink and color her traditional art digitally. Over the last few years she has been honing her craft, drawing main stream characters and developing her own. 

THE COVERS

 

TAKE A LOOK BEHIND THE SCENES - TIME LAPSE OF THE RED SONJA ART BEING DRAWN

 

 

GEM MINT

THE INVINCIBLE RED SONJA #1

 
This awesome special edition adorns the cover of a limited edition The Invincible Red Sonja #1 comic!  Written by the dynamic duo of Amanda Conner and Jimmy Palmiotti with art by Moriat, this is the fantasy epic event of the year! Red Sonja finds herself on a spectacular journey filled with pirates, mermaids, princesses, and political intrigue as the threat of two kingdoms hangs in the balance.

SAMPLE INTERIOR PAGES

CGC COPIES!

Have your cover slabbed and graded by CGC at 9.8 or higher!

SIGNED CGC COPIES

Have your copies signed and then graded at 9.8 or higher!

REMARQUED VIRGIN COVER

Jade will do an original sketch on each cover!

(each cover will have a unique piece of art so details will vary)

LIMITED EDITION RED SONJA STATUE

Based on the artwork of legendary artist Frank Thorne!

story:
Guardians of Erloth is a four-part, epic fantasy series chronicling the fall of the kingdom of Pardus and one hero’s journey to reclaim his birthright.

Volume Two follows Caius as he is liberated from the chains that have held him for five years and embark upon a journey of discovery. Along the way, he will meet a Guardian and his group of companions who help Caius harness his newfound magical powers.

Meanwhile, a dark force is laying a more sinister plan for Caius and the power he holds. Searching for the Shard of Pardus, a magical stone that has long been guarded by the Kings of Pardus, the Jade Sorceress and her minions will stop at nothing to control Caius. Through him and the power that the stone possesses she will become a great threat to all of Erloth. 

Volume Two will be a minimum of 48 Pages.

 

 

Stretch Goals

 

 

$3,250= Caius trading card for every backer at the $25 tier and up- UNLOCKED

$3.5K= 5" x 8" Battle of Duality art print for every backer at the $25 tier and up- UNLOCKED

100 Backers= Digital copy for every backer at the $25 tier and up- UNLOCKED

$5K= Backer choice bookmark- UNLOCKED

$7K= BlockHedz printed papercraft for every backer of the $25 tier and up- UNLOCKED

200 Backers= Interior cover art by Ryan Best- Inks only- LOCKED

$10K= Guardians of Erloth, Volume 2 will be perfect bound- LOCKED

$12K= Volume 2 will increase from 48 to 60 pages- LOCKED

500 Backers= ?????

$15K= Volume 2 will increase from 60 to 72 pages- LOCKED

$17K= Back cover art by Ryan Best- LOCKED

$20K= ?????

 

As some of you may know, the cost of producing a 48-page comic book can be rather expensive. This is why we need your help! Our goal for this campaign is $3,000. This will go towards paying Ryan for the rest of the interior art and Eric Weathers for lettering. Currently, we have 15 pages penciled, inked, and colored. 

Once we reach this goal, we will be adding stretch goals to help with printing costs.

What do you get? Both Volume One and Volume Two will be high quality books. This means an 80lb, high gloss, UV-coated cover with 80lb, high gloss interior paper. The books will come boarded and in a protective sleeve. They will be shipped inside a Gemini mailer to ensure the best protection during transit. These books are made to be pieces of art that can be enjoyed over and over again!

There are always risks when you invest in a crowd funding campaign. What if the campaign doesn't meet its goal?  What happens if my product comes damaged? What will happen if the book gets delayed?

All of these questions are 100% justified. With my first two campaigns I am proud to say we completed shipping and fulfillment 100%. With this campaign we set a fixed goal, so if we don't meet our goal you will be refunded 100%. If there are any delays I will update the campaign immediately and find a remedy for the delay. All damaged books will be replaced at no further cost to the backer.  (I just ask for photos of the shipment and product to find out what methods/packaging may have caused the damage.)

I promise you that the payoff far exceeds the risk.  We are well on our way to a fantastic product, with 15 pages of art and colors completed already. With your help, we can finish the book and bring to life the second installment of Guardians of Erloth: The Last Leopard King!

Choose the tier that appeals to you and then add on as many bonus items as you'd like when you check out!

Not ready to back at this time? No problem! You can still help me reach my goal by sharing this campaign. Make someone's day by introducing them to Guardians of Erloth today!

Twitter @ChaelRoberts     Instagram Scribe of Erloth     YouTube Comics du Nord

story:
The Inception!

     I’m really exited because I’ve been wanting to get this book published through Image Comics for a long time now. It’s been a journey. It all started when I wrote my book in 2017, the tail end of that summer. At the time, I was depressed because my mom started going through dialysis and she was not doing well. I thought she was going pass (thankfully, she’s still with us). I was going through other stuff too, that summer was not great for me. I felt that a black kid from Washington Heights wasn’t meant to be a writer, I felt defeated, insignificant. Then one bleak day, I was going through the motions, I popped in the Spiderman 2 DVD (Tobey Maguire’s Spiderman) and we know how great the film was, and is. The “Aunt May's motivational speech” scene struck a chord in my brain and that’s when everything I knew and felt started to take shape.

     In the movie, Peter gave up being Spiderman because of his emotional breakdown. It was then I saw the parallels between him and I. We get to the scene where Peter is helping Aunt May pack, and there she delivers her speech about the hero in all of us and what it means I be one. I took what she said to mean when people fall, we learn from it, we grow and get back up (A similar sentiment to what Thomas Wayne says to Bruce in Christopher Nolan’s Batman Begins).

 

My Debut Comic!

     After hearing that speech, I was primed with passion again! By the end of that summer I started to write a six-issue comicbook called Napoleon from the Machine. It took me three months to write and a few months of writing workshops to iron out the kinks. I had the scripts but was working a part-time job and couldn’t afford to pay for the illustrations, coloring and lettering. So I shelved the project in hopes I get a chance to one day bring it to life. Years went on and then we were all on lock down. I reached out to an awesome artist, by the name of Todor Hristov, about drawing my one-shot called ‘My Brother, Teddy’. It is my debut comicbook that I funded out of pocket. 

It was through Todor, I virtually met Sonya Anastasova, the colorist and then my team was born. Then I added a last minute addition to the team, I decided to add a musical score that gave my comicbook emotional weight. I collaborated with composer Lawren Brianna Ware to make that happen. It took time to put together, but I finally released my one-shot back in February 2021.

 

Why Indiegogo?

     I was so happy to finally have my book out for the world to see. I was able to put the project together because I had been working full-time for about two years. Fortunately, I was able to produce ‘My Brother, Teddy’, but I knew six issues will be costly to do alone, especially with school loans looming. So that is why I’m asking you backers for your help. For this project, I partnered with Sonya again and her awesome husband Konstantin Vitkov-Titis, the author and illustrator to Jack Eridon, a private detective who turns into a demon. This talented team is excited and willing to help my project come to life, and for that, I am grateful to them. As an independent creator, Indiegogo is a chance for me to publish and produce this comic. I hope this is the beginning that will jettison my career so I can achieve my dream as a multifaceted writer in the entertainment world.

The Story. 

     This project is a Neo-superhero graphic novel takes place in a somewhat near future; the year is 2094, New York City. The story is about the eponymous hero, who is depressed and an alcoholic. Napoleon has the ability to manifest his drawings into reality. Before the story’s present setting, Napoleon had unintentionally created a name for himself. To the world, he’s known as the mysterious being, Kami; a moniker given to him by the Japanese. The story begins four years after the loss of his wife, Maggie, to a terminal illness. In the present, we find Napoleon deep in grief, not using his powers as much as he did at his prime.

Napoleon seldom uses his abilities to conjure the Man in Black, one of the caricatures that frequently patrols the neighborhood. Napoleon tries to use his abilities is in an attempt to bring his wife back to life, in which he can’t because his powers don't extend that far. All these years neglecting the world, a global terrorist group, known as Angels, have nearly taken over the entire planet. Their goal is to force the world into a one unified country by any means necessary.

Setting

     The world is similar to our reality, in aesthetics. There are larger, pristine buildings in the city akin to Minority Report or Gattaca. The story begins uptown, in Washington Heights.  Unlike downtown, the neighborhood still has old buildings with solar panels installed on rooftops.

As the reader, you’ll see there's more of a focus in the uptown areas including the Bronx. You’ll see most of the neighborhood through the eyes of Angel insurrectionists as the story progresses.

Amie, one of Napoleon’s neighbors, is killed in an attack, leaving her daughter, Justine, behind. After the incident, he finds within himself to tap into what made him special. With a brief sense of responsibility and guilt, Napoleon goes out of his way to protect Justine. Coming out of his melancholy, Napoleon is slowly starting to reclaim a shadow of his former self. Will he use his abilities to save the world or let his grief consume him?

 I poured my heart and grief into this story, I hope this book is enough to be a guide anyone who feels defeated or lost. Again, thankfully my mom is still with us and I can’t wait to hand her a copy of Napoleon from the Machine #1. This comic was also a thank you letter to one of my role models, Stan Lee, before he passed. But I believe he’ll see my story from whatever universe he’s in now. But for everyone on Earth-1218, this project is for anyone that feels they are without purpose, or for those that just love comics. I want this book to reignite the fire in you. I hope this first issue generates buzz, and like a domino effect, the other five will follow suit and be in your hands…

I’m a writer, and my creations are for you! 

 

Risks and challenges

The vast majority of the budget will be going back to fairly compensating the illustrator and colorist, Konstantin and Sonya. If we exceed our goal, the surplus will be used to produce the NAPOLEON FROM THE MACHINE #2 and so on. This is my first Indiegogo campaign and I’m anxious. I have a lot of positive energy aimed to reach our goal! This will be my second comicbook that I publish. I figure if I could put a team together for ‘My Btother, Teddy’ and completed it, we can get this project done too. The script is written and has been edited in full. There is always a risk that work on pages will run slightly behind, but I’ve worked with many artists and Konstantin produces pages on-time and very quickly, exceeding my expectations. If there are any issues I’ll update you all. This is a passion project that will be fully realized. We are all committed to getting this book into your hands.

Ways You Can Help Us!

Some people may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share and spread the story of my campaign!
  • Use Indiegogo's share tools!
  • Word of mouth is great too!

I took what she said to mean when people fall, we learn from it, we grow and get back up (A similar sentiment to what Thomas Wayne says to Bruce in Christopher Nolan’s Batman Begins).
 
My Debut Comic!
     After hearing that speech, I was primed with passion again! By the end of that summer I started to write a six-issue comicbook called Napoleon from the Machine. It took me three months to write and a few months of writing workshops to iron out the kinks. I had the scripts but was working a part-time job and couldn’t afford to pay for the illustrations, coloring and lettering. So I shelved the project in hopes I get a chance to one day bring it to life. Years went on and then we were all on lock down. I reached out to an awesome artist, by the name of Todor Hristov, about drawing my one-shot called ‘My Brother, Teddy’. It is my debut comicbook that I funded out of pocket. 

It was through Todor, I virtually met Sonya Anastasova, the colorist and then my team was born. Then I added a last minute addition to the team, I decided to add a musical score that gave my comicbook emotional weight. I collaborated with composer Lawren Brianna Ware to make that happen. It took time to put together, but I finally released my one-shot back in February 2021.
 
Why Indiegogo?
     I was so happy to finally have my book out for the world to see. I was able to put the project together because I had been working full-time for about two years. Fortunately, I was able to produce ‘My Brother, Teddy’, but I knew six issues will be costly to do alone, especially with school loans looming. So that is why I’m asking you backers for your help. For this project, I partnered with Sonya again and her awesome husband Konstantin Vitkov-Titis, the author and illustrator to Jack Eridon, a private detective who turns into a demon. This talented team is excited and willing to help my project come to life, and for that, I am grateful to them. As an independent creator, Indiegogo is a chance for me to publish and produce this comic. I hope this is the beginning that will jettison my career so I can achieve my dream as a multifaceted writer in the entertainment world.

The Story. 
     This project is a Neo-superhero graphic novel takes place in a somewhat near future; the year is 2094, New York City. The story is about the eponymous hero, who is depressed and an alcoholic. Napoleon has the ability to manifest his drawings into reality. Before the story’s present setting, Napoleon had unintentionally created a name for himself. To the world, he’s known as the mysterious being, Kami; a moniker given to him by the Japanese. The story begins four years after the loss of his wife, Maggie, to a terminal illness. In the present, we find Napoleon deep in grief, not using his powers as much as he did at his prime.

Napoleon seldom uses his abilities to conjure the Man in Black, one of the caricatures that frequently patrols the neighborhood. Napoleon tries to use his abilities is in an attempt to bring his wife back to life, in which he can’t because his powers don't extend that far. All these years neglecting the world, a global terrorist group, known as Angels, have nearly taken over the entire planet. Their goal is to force the world into a one unified country by any means necessary.

Setting
     The world is similar to our reality, in aesthetics. There are larger, pristine buildings in the city akin to Minority Report or Gattaca. The story begins uptown, in Washington Heights.  Unlike downtown, the neighborhood still has old buildings with solar panels installed on rooftops.

As the reader, you’ll see there's more of a focus in the uptown areas including the Bronx. You’ll see most of the neighborhood through the eyes of Angel insurrectionists as the story progresses.

Amie, one of Napoleon’s neighbors, is killed in an attack, leaving her daughter, Justine, behind. After the incident, he finds within himself to tap into what made him special. With a brief sense of responsibility and guilt, Napoleon goes out of his way to protect Justine. Coming out of his melancholy, Napoleon is slowly starting to reclaim a shadow of his former self. Will he use his abilities to save the world or let his grief consume him?

 I poured my heart and grief into this story, I hope this book is enough to be a guide anyone who feels defeated or lost. Again, thankfully my mom is still with us and I can’t wait to hand her a copy of Napoleon from the Machine #1. This comic was also a thank you letter to one of my role models, Stan Lee, before he passed. But I believe he’ll see my story from whatever universe he’s in now. But for everyone on Earth-1218, this project is for anyone that feels they are without purpose, or for those that just love comics. I want this book to reignite the fire in you. I hope this first issue generates buzz, and like a domino effect, the other five will follow suit and be in your hands…
I’m a writer, and my creations are for you! 
 
Risks and challenges
The vast majority of the budget will be going back to fairly compensating the illustrator and colorist, Konstantin and Sonya. If we exceed our goal, the surplus will be used to produce the NAPOLEON FROM THE MACHINE #2 and so on. This is my first Indiegogo campaign and I’m anxious. I have a lot of positive energy aimed to reach our goal! This will be my second comicbook that I publish. I figure if I could put a team together for ‘My Btother, Teddy’ and completed it, we can get this project done too. The script is written and has been edited in full. There is always a risk that work on pages will run slightly behind, but I’ve worked with many artists and Konstantin produces pages on-time and very quickly, exceeding my expectations. If there are any issues I’ll update you all. This is a passion project that will be fully realized. We are all committed to getting this book into your hands.

Ways You Can Help Us!
Some people may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Share and spread the story of my campaign!
Use Indiegogo's share tools!
Word of mouth is great too!

story:
"Sometimes I just feel like doing 499 push-ups and calling it a day..."

499 is a 64-page color graphic novel set in an alternate history where the US fought a ground war with Russia that lasted for DECADES.

At West Hill High, a group of of seniors are trying to make it through their final year of high school before they are drafted and sent off to war.

"Sometimes I just feel like doing 499" is spray-painted on the scoreboard of the football field. This single act of rebellion pushes the older generation into a rage. 

A hunt for the dissident is conducted by the battle-scarred combat veterans who act as the faculty of the school.

Paul Devore is the former quarterback of the football team. After accepting a challenge to duel from Vaughn, a romantic rival, Paul has to back out of the duel when he mysteriously injures his hand. The whole school thinks that Paul is a coward who is faking an injury...but the truth is much WORSE.

Doug, Paul's only remaining friend, introduces him to the 499 Club, a group of dissident artists.

Missy, Paul's ex-girlfriend is a member of the 499 Club. It's complicated.

Pressure builds for someone to identify the traitor...and Paul realizes that betraying the members of the 499 Club may be his ticket back to his former glory.

 

499 is created by NARZACK (Narwhal + Zack) a true artistic pairing, each contributing creatively 100% to the book.

 

 

ALSO AVAILABLE AS BUNDLE OR ADD-ON

P.O.D. (PAYMENT ON DELIVERY)

The leaders of Earth must deal with the ramifications of a decades-old secret treaty between Nazi Germany and an Alien Empire when the Aliens arrive on Earth to collect payment for holding up their end of the agreement!

24-page, black-and-white comic book.

 

ADD-ONS

FOREIGN AGENT, the critically acclaimed 190-Page black-and-white graphic novel from Narwhal, is also available as an Add-On.

As is Richard Meyer's IMPOSSIBLE STARS graphic novel.

 

STRETCH GOALS!

$50,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED!*- Narwhal Stickers!

$60,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED!*-  Alpha High Hall Pass!

$75,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED!*- Large Postcard Print!

$90,000 STRETCH GOAL-  Additional Mini-Comic!

story:
Hi, I'm Kyle Ritter! I've been in the comic making business for almost 8 years and was most recently the colorist for the smash Indiegogo success CYBERFROG: BLOODHONEY!

Now I'm creating my very own graphic novel! STARBLADES is the first book in a planned trilogy and is starting off as a 48-page graphic novel! 

I need your help bringing STARBLADES to life, join me by backing this campaign and I promise to deliver top-quality art and a story that will have you waiting in anticipation for the next installment of STARBLADES! 

UNLOCKED!

$40,000 stretch goal announced expanding the book to 60 PAGES of story!

$50,000 stretch goal announced expanding the book to 90 PAGES!  Adding 30 pages of additional content including a cover gallery, pin-ups, black and white inked pages, concept art and more. 

It will also include a LEGEND OF THE STARBLADES backup story, written and illustrated by Kyle Ritter. Featuring an untold tale of the characters origins in the style of an illustrated novel.

Thank you so much for all your support!

Preview Pages

story:
Born into the outcast breed of werewolves known as the Monoki, eighteen-year-old Rodney Marcelli is reluctantly thrown into an ancient war between good and evil in today's world where the line has blurred. With the help of Snow Paw, the Pureblood Monoki, and the supernatural evil slayer, Night Hunter, Rod must learn to master his newly found lycanthropy and mysterious kinetic energy power that only he possesses. Rod must fight the Dark Covenant in order to avenge his friends and family, and to save the girl he loves from the master vampire, Lord Malice. Rodney Marcelli is Night Wolf!

Night Wolf Volume 1 Trade Paperback

Night Wolf Volume 1 Trade Paperback Die Cut Hard Cover Open

Night Wolf Chapter 1

 Rodney Marcelli, a small town high school senior from a wealthy family, had everything a teenage boy could want; popularity, a beautiful girlfriend, and a full-ride football scholarship to Keystone State University. However, as his eighteenth birthday draws near Rodney is haunted by nightmares of ghoulish creatures and visions of losing his loved ones. During his waking life, Rodney starts to notice elements of his nightmares are coming true as vampires, werewolves, witches, and demons start to invade his sleepy little town.

Night Wolf Chapter 1 Previews

 

Night Wolf Chapter 2

 Rodney Marcelli, still haunted by nightmarish visions, has a growing concern that something terrible is about to happen in his sleepy little town. On the night of his 18th birthday, Rod and his girlfriend, Jennifer Conway, are attending their high school Homecoming Dance, where they are crowned Queen and King. Their celebration dance is cut short by the twin witches, Janelle and Circe, who crash the party unleashing monsters upon the unsuspecting student body and faculty. Rod and Jen barely make their escape outside only to be confronted by the bloodthirsty werewolf, Black Claw.

Night Wolf Chapter 2 Previews

 

Night Wolf Chapter 3

 Rodney Marcelli is left for dead after his first encounter with the cruel werewolf, Black Claw, who has taken Rod’s girlfriend, Jennifer Conway, prisoner. Rod awakens the next morning in the hospital where he overhears a doctor speaking with FBI Agents, who want to question Rod about the four missing teenage girls and the massacre at the Homecoming Dance. Afraid the Agents would not believe him, Rod quickly escapes out a window. Upon returning home, Rod discovers a horrifying scene left for him. Then, without warning he is overtaken by horde of vampires and werewolves.

Night Wolf Chapter 3 Previews

 

Night Wolf Chapter 4

 After fending off a horde of vampires and werewolves, Rodney Marcelli and Snow Paw flee to escape the FBI Special Investigation Agents, who have come to investigate the scene. While hiding in the dense woods behind Rodney’s family’s home, Snow Paw tells him of their Monoki werewolf heritage. Snow Paw concludes that Rodney is unlike all other members of their breed. Then without warning, the supernatural monster slayer, Night Hunter, drops in on them armed to the teeth, with his sights on Rodney.

Night Wolf Chapter 4 Previews

 

This campaign is for both new and current Wolf Pack members. Each chapter will include new story pages for current members to enjoy, and new members can enjoy the awesome story thus far in one graphic novel.

  • Fans of Supernatural, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Underworld, and other anti-hero monster horror stories.
  • People who like stories that encompass elements of horror, magic, and science in a modern setting.
  • Collectors of high quality modern independent TRADE PAPER BACKS from an amazing team of up-and-comers!
  • If you like unique takes on the horror, supernatural, theology, mythology, and fantasy genres.
  • If you love stories about supernatural beings like werewolves,  vampires, demons, witches, zombies and more then this is THE GRAPHIC NOVEL FOR YOU!

 

What Exactly Do You Get When You Join the WOLF PACK and Back This Campaign? 

  • Night Wolf Volume 1 is a trade paperback that collects the first four issues of Night Wolf and features extra content, over 150 pages of story and art. The Soft Cover is a standard American comic size printed on high-quality paper. The Hard Cover is a graphic novel, featuring a special DIE-CUT translucent werewolf cover.
  • At higher pledge levels, backers will access campaign exclusive mystery boxes possibly containing CGC graded Night Wolf comics, limited edition variants, rare comics signed by both the writer and artists, as well as awesome merchandise!
  • At highest levels, limited opportunities to get your own art commission by Carlos Herrera!

Critics, Pros, & Fans Are Absolutely Howling About Night Wolf! Here's They Are Saying...

 

 

Since the release of Night Wolf Issue 1 I've been traveling to comic cons around the North East of the United States meeting people and introducing them to Night Wolf. The Wolf Pack is constantly growing in numbers, and we need you! Will you be the next member to join?

 

 

Here's What Wolf Pack Members are Saying...

“Just received my package of comics and am blown away. The comics looked good in pictures, but are even more spectacular in person. One of the  best buys I have made recently. Can’t wait for what’s next.” - Arthur DeWitt 

“Just finished reading, couldn't put them down.” - Daniel Bott

“I read the first issue of his comic I immediately fell in love...” - Eddie Garcia

“Finally, we’ve got a good story with a werewolf as the main hero! So, I’m very exited!” - Alexandr Gutnikov

“I'm hooked! If you're a fan of the classic monsters then this series is for you.” - Anthony Lamberti

“Extremely well written and absolutely amazing artwork! - Steven Beltzer

“I love this comic. Can't wait to read another!" - Frederick Knight

 

 

Hi, I'm Robert A. Multari, but you can call me Rob. It’s been my dream since I was a kid, struggling with Attention Deficit Disorder and Dyslexia, to be in the comic book business. Comic books helped me learn how to deal with my learning disability. When I was 14-years-old, I wrote fan fiction for the X-Men and submitted it to Marvel in hopes that Stan Lee would read it. Someone from Marvel was nice enough to write back to me saying that Stan loves to hear from his fans and encouraged me to keep up my writing. As naive as I was at the time, it spread my passion for the business like a wild fire and inspired me to go to art school at Edinboro University of Pennsylvania, where I graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts Degree in Applied Media Arts. I have been working on Night Wolf since I was 16-years-old. The story and the characters have grown up with me, evolving into the amazing tale that it is today.

Why a werewolf comic book? Well, I have always loved any werewolf or supernatural related entertainment in movies, video games, etc. I didn't feel like there were any comic books out there doing werewolves any justice, so I decided to make a comic book based on a werewolf anti-hero myself. In high school, after I started developing Night Wolf, I got into Werewolf: The Apocalypse is a role-playing game by White Wolf Publishing.  I love the artwork in the game guides so much that I longed for them to put out a comic book to build on their world. Unfortunately, it never happened, but the artwork heavily influenced how I like my werewolves should look in my comics.

Carlos Herrera is a Professional illustrator residing in Santiago City, Chile. His amazing portfolio of artwork spans not only from his Chilean home but from abroad as well. Carlos specializes in heroic fantasy illustrations, comic book illustrations, and educational illustrations for schoolbooks. Carlos's talent stretches across various types of media and color illustration. He uses both traditional media meaning pencil, watercolor, graphite, acrylic, and more as well as digital media in use of a Wacom Tablet and Adobe Photoshop. Carlos graduated from Arcos Institute with the highest marks possible. For a long period of time Carlos was an active member of the Illustrator staff for the Salo S.A. Company's trading card game "Myths and Legends". Carlos is the illustrator for Night Wolf Issue 4. He also did the Night Wolf character designs, the full spread cover and the first 5 pages of issue 1, the illustration for the Night Wolf Issue 2 Variant Cover, and did all the art for the variant cover for issue 3 featuring Snow Paw.

Gat Melvyn is a digital colorist living in Johannesburg, South Africa. He has a Bachelor of Arts in Motion Picture Medium. He has done coloring work for Big Dog Ink and Image Comics. Gat is taking on the role of colorist for the Night Wolf series, starting with issue 3.  He is also the colorist on the Keystone Comic Con Exclusive Night Wolf Issue 1 Cover and the rare variant cover for Night Wolf Issue 4, penciled by Chris Williams and the new very limited variant cover of Night Wolf Issue 2, illustrated by Vincenzo Sansone.

Oscar Choquecota Ale is a professional illustrator residing in Lima, Perú. His amazing portfolio of artwork spans not only from his Peruvian home but from abroad as well. Oscar specializes in heroic, fantasy, anime, and comic book illustrations as well as video game concept development. Oscar's talent stretches across various types of media and color  illustration. His digital media tools of trade is a Wacom Tablet and  Adobe Photoshop. Oscar, owner of Bokuman Studio, is an illustrator with over 10 years experience. Oscar is the illustrator of Night Wolf Issues 1 - 3.

Ross A. Campbell is a Professional Digital Colorist residing in Elgin, Scotland. His amazing portfolio of artwork spans not only from his native home in the United Kingdom, but from abroad as well. Ross has had no formal art school training, but is self-taught with an unbelievably natural eye for colors, lighting, and shadow creating amazing depth of space within the 2D realm. He has been in the business for over 5 years primarily working as a comic book colorist, with the occasional full illustration job. Ross's works include mostly the fantasy genre, but also dabbles in other genres as well. His color weapons of choice are the Wacom Tablet and Adobe Photoshop. Some of Ross's clientele include DC, Action Lab, Image, Dynamite, Aspen, Top Cow, Sideshow, Zenescope, PKMM Entertainment, and Scout Comics. Ross did the colors for Night Wolf Issue 1 where Carlos left off, and he also colored the Night Wolf Issue 2 Variant Cover.

Chris Williams is a comic artist, writer and creator. After earning his BA in Animation & Media Arts in 2008 from the Art Institute of Philadelphia, Chris has sold many commissioned & contracted works locally and internationally. Some of his notable published works include cover art for Big Dog Ink (BDI)'s "Critter" & "Penny For Your Soul", Kenzer & Co.'s “Knights of The Dinner Table”, Markosia's "Geek-Girl", Source Point Press' "Salvagers" & "Franklin & Ghost", as well as promotional art for award-winning photographer, Nick Saglimbeni and his SlickForce Girl site. Chris is currently working on his creator owned comic series, "SUMMONS", among other upcoming indie titles. Chris is the illustrator of the Keystone Comic Con exclusive cover of Night Wolf Issue 1, the rare variant cover for Night Wolf Issue 4, and the limited variant cover for the Night Wolf Volume 1 Trade Paperback.

Guest Writers

The Night Wolf Volume 1 digital edition features 16 extra pages of story, contributed by very talented guest writers. Tyler James Vogel, writer of The Red Ten and owner of ComixTribe and ComixLaunch, has written four pages that has been added to chapter one. Madeleine Holly-Rosing, writer of the Boston Metaphysical Society, has written four pages that has been added to chapter two. Travis Gibb, writer of Broke Down & Four Dead Bodies, has written four pages that has been added to chapter three. Last but certainly not least Kevin Joseph, writer of Tart from Scout Comics, has written four pages that has been added to chapter four. 

Cover Art & Pin Up Artists

The Night Wolf Volume 1 trade paperback will feature extra cover art and brand new pin ups, contributed by very talented guest artists. Including Joseph Schmalke (The Electric Black, Scout Comics), Conor Hughes (White Ash, Scout Comics), Sean Forney (Scarlet Huntress), Dirk Tiede (Paradigm Shift), Joe Mulvey (The Wailing Blade, ComixTribe), and many more!

 

  • The IndieGoGo Campaign: February 3 - 23, 2021
  • Book Manufacturing and Freight: End of February 2021
  • Expected Deliver to US IndieGoGo Backers: Mid March 2021
  • Expected Deliver for INT IndieGoGo Backers: End March 2021

As a life time comic book collector, I know there's nothing worse than backing a comic project and then having your rewards arrive damaged. Therefore, all comics shipped will be individually bagged with boards, and will be secured in Gemini Comic Supply Comic Flash Mailers, which provides impact-resistant protection.

Orders with multiple comics will be sandwich packed and secured for additional protection. The Mystery Boxes will be BUBBLE WRAPPED before being inserted into a second shipping box, so that it arrives in great condition.

Furthermore, for this campaign, I will be handling fulfillment 100% in-house. I want to make sure that everything arrives to you as quickly as possible and limit the possibility of unforeseen delays, which is why I will be rolling up my sleeves to personally overseeing fulfillment for every backer.

I would like to personally thank you in advance for backing pre-ordering the Night Wolf Volume trade paperback and joining the Wolf Pack! I’m extremely grateful for where I am now since publishing first 4 issues of Night Wolf. I'm very thankful for the opportunity to tackle a new media by bring this gorgeous collectors graphic novel to life!

What's Next? Join the Wolf Pack Today! 

You've made it this far into the wolf's den, so what are waiting for? Join the Wolf Pack today! Scroll back up this page, choose a howling reward, and pledge to be a part of this campaign today. Again, thank you, for taking this creative journey with me. I appreciate so it so much!

Risks and Challenges

Publishing a trade paperback is a new media for me to explore, and I look forward to adding it to my toolbox. I know 2020 was challenging and there's a lot going on all over the world right now. This turmoil is very stressful for us all. Collecting, reading, and creating comics books have always been an escape from the stressful things in my life. My hope is that by creating my comics books and putting them out into the world for you to enjoy also helps to relieve some of your stress as well. And that is what I am laser focused on doing! The books are 100% complete and off to the printer, Printlore. The books are being printed in China, so the time of delivery will depend on when the shipment arrives to me. However, once the packages hits my front porch I will ready to hit the ground running with order fulfillment! Thank you again!

One of the  best buys I have made recently. Can’t wait for what’s next.” - Arthur DeWitt “Just finished reading, couldn't put them down.” - Daniel Bott“I read the first issue of his comic I immediately fell in love...” - Eddie Garcia“Finally, we’ve got a good story with a werewolf as the main hero! So, I’m very exited!” - Alexandr Gutnikov“I'm hooked! If you're a fan of the classic monsters then this series is for you.” - Anthony Lamberti“Extremely well written and absolutely amazing artwork! - Steven Beltzer“I love this comic. Can't wait to read another!" - Frederick Knight  Hi, I'm Robert A. Multari, but you can call me Rob. It’s been my dream since I was a kid, struggling with Attention Deficit Disorder and Dyslexia, to be in the comic book business. Comic books helped me learn how to deal with my learning disability. When I was 14-years-old, I wrote fan fiction for the X-Men and submitted it to Marvel in hopes that Stan Lee would read it. Someone from Marvel was nice enough to write back to me saying that Stan loves to hear from his fans and encouraged me to keep up my writing. As naive as I was at the time, it spread my passion for the business like a wild fire and inspired me to go to art school at Edinboro University of Pennsylvania, where I graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts Degree in Applied Media Arts. I have been working on Night Wolf since I was 16-years-old. The story and the characters have grown up with me, evolving into the amazing tale that it is today.Why a werewolf comic book? Well, I have always loved any werewolf or supernatural related entertainment in movies, video games, etc. I didn't feel like there were any comic books out there doing werewolves any justice, so I decided to make a comic book based on a werewolf anti-hero myself. In high school, after I started developing Night Wolf, I got into Werewolf: The Apocalypse is a role-playing game by White Wolf Publishing.  I love the artwork in the game guides so much that I longed for them to put out a comic book to build on their world. Unfortunately, it never happened, but the artwork heavily influenced how I like my werewolves should look in my comics.Carlos Herrera is a Professional illustrator residing in Santiago City, Chile. His amazing portfolio of artwork spans not only from his Chilean home but from abroad as well. Carlos specializes in heroic fantasy illustrations, comic book illustrations, and educational illustrations for schoolbooks. Carlos's talent stretches across various types of media and color illustration. He uses both traditional media meaning pencil, watercolor, graphite, acrylic, and more as well as digital media in use of a Wacom Tablet and Adobe Photoshop. Carlos graduated from Arcos Institute with the highest marks possible. For a long period of time Carlos was an active member of the Illustrator staff for the Salo S.A. Company's trading card game "Myths and Legends". Carlos is the illustrator for Night Wolf Issue 4. He also did the Night Wolf character designs, the full spread cover and the first 5 pages of issue 1, the illustration for the Night Wolf Issue 2 Variant Cover, and did all the art for the variant cover for issue 3 featuring Snow Paw.Gat Melvyn is a digital colorist living in Johannesburg, South Africa. He has a Bachelor of Arts in Motion Picture Medium. He has done coloring work for Big Dog Ink and Image Comics. Gat is taking on the role of colorist for the Night Wolf series, starting with issue 3.  He is also the colorist on the Keystone Comic Con Exclusive Night Wolf Issue 1 Cover and the rare variant cover for Night Wolf Issue 4, penciled by Chris Williams and the new very limited variant cover of Night Wolf Issue 2, illustrated by Vincenzo Sansone.Oscar Choquecota Ale is a professional illustrator residing in Lima, Perú. His amazing portfolio of artwork spans not only from his Peruvian home but from abroad as well. Oscar specializes in heroic, fantasy, anime, and comic book illustrations as well as video game concept development. Oscar's talent stretches across various types of media and color  illustration. His digital media tools of trade is a Wacom Tablet and  Adobe Photoshop. Oscar, owner of Bokuman Studio, is an illustrator with over 10 years experience. Oscar is the illustrator of Night Wolf Issues 1 - 3.Ross A. Campbell is a Professional Digital Colorist residing in Elgin, Scotland. His amazing portfolio of artwork spans not only from his native home in the United Kingdom, but from abroad as well. Ross has had no formal art school training, but is self-taught with an unbelievably natural eye for colors, lighting, and shadow creating amazing depth of space within the 2D realm. He has been in the business for over 5 years primarily working as a comic book colorist, with the occasional full illustration job. Ross's works include mostly the fantasy genre, but also dabbles in other genres as well. His color weapons of choice are the Wacom Tablet and Adobe Photoshop. Some of Ross's clientele include DC, Action Lab, Image, Dynamite, Aspen, Top Cow, Sideshow, Zenescope, PKMM Entertainment, and Scout Comics. Ross did the colors for Night Wolf Issue 1 where Carlos left off, and he also colored the Night Wolf Issue 2 Variant Cover.Chris Williams is a comic artist, writer and creator. After earning his BA in Animation & Media Arts in 2008 from the Art Institute of Philadelphia, Chris has sold many commissioned & contracted works locally and internationally. Some of his notable published works include cover art for Big Dog Ink (BDI)'s "Critter" & "Penny For Your Soul", Kenzer & Co.'s “Knights of The Dinner Table”, Markosia's "Geek-Girl", Source Point Press' "Salvagers" & "Franklin & Ghost", as well as promotional art for award-winning photographer, Nick Saglimbeni and his SlickForce Girl site. Chris is currently working on his creator owned comic series, "SUMMONS", among other upcoming indie titles. Chris is the illustrator of the Keystone Comic Con exclusive cover of Night Wolf Issue 1, the rare variant cover for Night Wolf Issue 4, and the limited variant cover for the Night Wolf Volume 1 Trade Paperback.Guest WritersThe Night Wolf Volume 1 digital edition features 16 extra pages of story, contributed by very talented guest writers. Tyler James Vogel, writer of The Red Ten and owner of ComixTribe and ComixLaunch, has written four pages that has been added to chapter one. Madeleine Holly-Rosing, writer of the Boston Metaphysical Society, has written four pages that has been added to chapter two. Travis Gibb, writer of Broke Down & Four Dead Bodies, has written four pages that has been added to chapter three. Last but certainly not least Kevin Joseph, writer of Tart from Scout Comics, has written four pages that has been added to chapter four. Cover Art & Pin Up ArtistsThe Night Wolf Volume 1 trade paperback will feature extra cover art and brand new pin ups, contributed by very talented guest artists. Including Joseph Schmalke (The Electric Black, Scout Comics), Conor Hughes (White Ash, Scout Comics), Sean Forney (Scarlet Huntress), Dirk Tiede (Paradigm Shift), Joe Mulvey (The Wailing Blade, ComixTribe), and many more! 
The IndieGoGo Campaign: February 3 - 23, 2021
Book Manufacturing and Freight: End of February 2021
Expected Deliver to US IndieGoGo Backers: Mid March 2021
Expected Deliver for INT IndieGoGo Backers: End March 2021
As a life time comic book collector, I know there's nothing worse than backing a comic project and then having your rewards arrive damaged. Therefore, all comics shipped will be individually bagged with boards, and will be secured in Gemini Comic Supply Comic Flash Mailers, which provides impact-resistant protection.Orders with multiple comics will be sandwich packed and secured for additional protection. The Mystery Boxes will be BUBBLE WRAPPED before being inserted into a second shipping box, so that it arrives in great condition.Furthermore, for this campaign, I will be handling fulfillment 100% in-house. I want to make sure that everything arrives to you as quickly as possible and limit the possibility of unforeseen delays, which is why I will be rolling up my sleeves to personally overseeing fulfillment for every backer.I would like to personally thank you in advance for backing pre-ordering the Night Wolf Volume trade paperback and joining the Wolf Pack! I’m extremely grateful for where I am now since publishing first 4 issues of Night Wolf. I'm very thankful for the opportunity to tackle a new media by bring this gorgeous collectors graphic novel to life!What's Next? Join the Wolf Pack Today! You've made it this far into the wolf's den, so what are waiting for? Join the Wolf Pack today! Scroll back up this page, choose a howling reward, and pledge to be a part of this campaign today. Again, thank you, for taking this creative journey with me. I appreciate so it so much!Risks and ChallengesPublishing a trade paperback is a new media for me to explore, and I look forward to adding it to my toolbox. I know 2020 was challenging and there's a lot going on all over the world right now. This turmoil is very stressful for us all. Collecting, reading, and creating comics books have always been an escape from the stressful things in my life. My hope is that by creating my comics books and putting them out into the world for you to enjoy also helps to relieve some of your stress as well. And that is what I am laser focused on doing! The books are 100% complete and off to the printer, Printlore. The books are being printed in China, so the time of delivery will depend on when the shipment arrives to me. However, once the packages hits my front porch I will ready to hit the ground running with order fulfillment! Thank you again!

story:
The Story.

The earth has fallen into a state of lawlessness. As chaos reigns guardian angels attempt to protect the innocent, but many times evil prevails, and the innocents pay the price. After seeing the pain and terror for many years one guardian decides to “fall” to not only protect but to make those causing the pain and suffering to pay.

Even though this well intended decision was made for good, there are ramifications to the fallen. Lilith may have enhanced strength, speed and agility but, there is always the inner dark fallen angel trying to surface. So, she not only now fights crime but must keep her inner demon at bay as well.

In a world filled with crime.

One would make a personal sacrifice

To begin to set things right.

She will be the help we need and the Hero we Fear!

This campaign is for both the 16 page Book 0 (Lilith's origin) as well as the 22 page Book 1 of this new ongoing Hero series.

 

The Funds for this project will be strictly to help offset the cost of printing the artwork is 100% complete and ready to go. With your help we will bring this new hero to life.

 

STRETCH GOALS

            Fully Funded Extra Perk Item                UNLOCKED

750.00 ----------Lilith Hat                         UNLOCKED

            1000.00------------------ TBD                      LOCKED

 

Lilith was created by Wes Knodel with art work by Marcelo Briseno.
