story:
Numb is a horror mystery comic that brings together surreal horror, character driven drama and traditional art made with watercolors!

Susan and Levi are childhood friends who have drifted apart. However their plans to reunite take a drastic turn when Levi ends up in an accident that has something else behind it than just careless street crossing. Old strains are being brought up and something sinister is lurking around.

One cannot brush past the Field’s call…

The story is suitable for older teens and adult audiences.

 

I'm Niina Eveliina Salmelin, master of arts, art teacher, illustration and comic artist from Finland. 

I have worked on Numb for about ten years now and it's been published as a webcomic since 2015. This comic is truly a great passion project of mine and it showcases both my growth as an artist and a storyteller. I'm proud to be finally making my dreams of printing it come true.

You can find Numb online here. 



Praise for Numb


"Numb is a promising new webcomic that uses its surreal art to create visually experimental psychological horror that pushes the medium's boundaries"
                                                                                                                        -Scary Cleve, The Outhousers 


"I still cannot get over the amazing plot buildup that has been created for Numb"
                                                                                                         -Wintre, Wintrekitty reviews


"The best aspect of this webcomic is the artwork. You can tell a lot of effort was put into each page."
                                                                                                                         -Rocco Sansone, Review Fix



 

 

 

-You get the PDF file of volume 1, collecting the prologue and first 5 chapters!
-Your name will be included in the "thank you" -page!


                                                                                          

-You will get a set of three B5 (176×250mm) size art prints!
​-You get the PDF file of volume 1, collecting the prologue and first 5 chapters!
-Your name will be included in the "thank you" -page!
                                              

-You get the printed version of volume 1.

-Your name will be included in the "thank you" -page!
                                       

-You get the printed version of volume 1.

​-You get the PDF file of volume 1, collecting the prologue and first 5 chapters!
-Your name will be included in the "thank you" -page!
                             

-You get a digital portrait style drawing of the Numb character of your choosing!
-You get the printed version of volume 1.
​-You will get a set of three B5 (176×250mm) size art prints!

-You get a traditional ink commission illustration from me (scroll down for examples)!

-Your name will be included in the "thank you" -page!

----

Every contribution for the campaign will get a wallpaper & a digital thank you image. 

Other ways to support the campaign is sharing it and spreading the word!
Thank you!

 

 

Goal of this campaign is to collect funds for printing the first volume of Numb. This collects the first 5 chapters and 212 pages.

The collected funds will be used to cover printing & shipping costs, alongside with Indiegogo & service fees. I also left room for a little safety net, just in case of any surprises. 

 

 


3000€ - Everyone gets a badge set
4000€ - Everyone gets a sticker set


 

The risks for this project are pretty minimal, since the comic is already done. Currently I'm in the middle of editing speech bubbles and fixing typos & lettering, but I'm halfway finished with those as well, so the book should be ready for print them moment this campaign ends!

story:
NEW LIMITED REWARDS ANNOUNCED...
(please see the description in the rewards)

**LIMITED TO 10 PER PRINT -- DON'T MISS OUT !!


**LIMITED TO 10 -- DON'T MISS OUT !!

------------------------------------------

The world is in the middle of a pandemic... and we wanted to help any way we could.
BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP !

We've created a really unique collectible that we feel will benefit those in need... a limited edition Virus card.
Here's a great way to 'catch the Virus' without getting sick, and help others in need, all from your living room !!



Each card contains art by comic book and trading card artists Rusty Gilligan and Jay Mooers - uniquely designed - signed by BOTH artists on the back - and is sealed in a special hard plastic sleeve with a clear plastic sticker !




SPECIAL BONUS:

* Each sealed card comes with 1 unsealed version - also signed by both artists !

* Every contribution comes with 3 random signed promo cards from past conventions and appearances !

CHECK BACK OFTEN FOR 1-OF-A-KIND REWARDS AND SPECIAL OFFERS !

 






The rewards are pretty straight forward - but check back often for new specials and additions !





Jay Mooers is an avid story-teller and uses every tool in his arsenal to tell them, be it paint, words, or even theater. He began his art career by directing and writing stage plays including a series of fantasy adventures called Bloodlines. He also created the webcomic Next to Nowhere. He illustrated children’s books and horror novels, along with painting murals and portraits throughout the years. In 2011, Jay completed his first solo novel, Illweed, the success of which prompted him to begin his comic series, Autumn Grey. With two titles under his belt, Jay co-founded Eden Park Tales in 2013 to publish these stories and more. His comic experience expanded, creating exclusive comic series and artwork for conventions including Chase Con in NY, Vermont Comic Con, and Lock City Comic Con in Connecticut as well as an assortment of indie comics with other writers. He has also done illustration work for Fallout, Elvira, Wizard of Oz, Sexy Scary Space and Sezame Street with Rusty Ink! and worked for Dynamite Comics on projects including Kiss, Dejah Thoris, Chaos, Vampirella, and Bettie Page.
You can check out his comics as well as other work via his publishing website, www.edenparktales.com . On this page, you’ll find a store where books and artwork can be purchased, as well as several free comic downloads!



Rusty Gilligan began his work as a professional comic book and film artist since 1978, with his formal debut as an artist on the original "Heavy Metal" 1981 film.
Since then, Rusty has worked on such films as The Avengers; The Walking Dead; Captain America: The First Avenger; Spider-Man 2 & 3 and art for many comic book and trading card projects. He's provided work for Marvel, DC, Image, Big Bang, Dynamite Comics, and many licensing projects to include:  Star Wars, Star Trek, DC Ent., Dr. Who, Night of the Living Dead, Vampirella, Major League Baseball, Cartoon Network, and many others.
Aside from creating the first sketch cards in the commercial market, he's designed and provided trading card art for Topps, Clubhouse Diamonds, Cryptozoic, Dynamite, Upper Deck, and Leaf just to name a few.
Recently, Rusty has been providing voice over work for films such as Dagon, The Man, Left 4 Dead, as well as Marvel and DC motion comics... video games such as Eternal Wars... and production art for a few new films. He currently publishes comic books based on his 'Mac and Trouble' and 'Symbol' properties, and soon will be debuting the 'Nightmare on Sezame Street' series as well as releasing 2 new trading card sets based on 'Wizard of Oz' and 'Sexy Scary Pulp' magazine covers.
You can find out more about Rusty on IMDB - his Facebook - and www.macandtrouble.com !




 

 

This project is brought to you by Rusty Ink!

 This project is brought to you by Rusty Ink!

story:
The team at Illumination Cinema is creating a new comic book series and we are kicking things off with THE DOG PARK: Volume 1! A graphic novel containing five new stories!

A single father and his absent-minded neighbor. Three young friends that are too adventurous for their own good. All of them are dogs, but it really doesn’t matter — so don’t even worry about it.  THE DOG PARK focuses on an ensemble of characters getting into absurd situations or just dealing with life’s little struggles in a grandiose way. Seriously though. There’s no bad dog puns or anything. The characters are just dogs. That’s it!

In writing and in presentation, THE DOG PARK takes inspiration from cartoons of the late nineties and early two-thousands. Each story is a balancing act of goofy, over-the-top situations and genuine character interactions. The idea is that this will appeal to older kids (say, ten and older) all the way up to the adults who grew up with this style of cartoon (you know who you are).

The goal of this campaign isn’t necessarily to help us make the comic itself. In fact, it’s pretty much finished. We’re currently wrapping up the last few pages and working on formatting. So what’s this all about, then?

Our campaign more or less creates a way for you to pre-order the book. By doing this, we can get paperback copies not only printed for you, but also stock up for conventions and any other great avenues for selling! If you’re looking to get yourself a copy and support the artists in the best way possible, you’re in the right place!

So here’s how the perks break down!

Honestly, we’re takin’ pretty low risks here. I guess a printer could explode? That would be pretty bad. We’d probably get a refund and get it printed somewhere else at that point. Maybe they’ll print a spelling mistake? I dunno.

As with any project like this, we plan on keeping things as straightforward, simple and transparent as possible. If anything goes wrong, you’ll be the first to know.

For anyone curious about what your average DOG PARK story might be like, we have created a couple of short cartoons that will be released during this campaign and we have also made the first of the five stories featured in Volume 1 free to read on various platforms. Check it out by following the links below…

VHX (Use code: FREETDP)
WEBTOON
TAPAS
GLOBAL COMIX

If you don’t have the funds to pick up a copy of the book, but still want to help, spreading the word is always good. Share our campaign on social media, share our posts, like our pages, spread the word via word of mouth. All good options.

You can also check out our art streams on Twitch, where we’ll be working on the comic. Can’t go wrong with that either!

TWITCH CHANNEL: https://www.twitch.tv/illuminationcinema
INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/dogparkcomics/
STUDIO INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/illuminationcinema/
STUDIO FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/illuminationcinema
STUDIO TWITTER: https://twitter.com/IlluminationCin

Once again, a sincere thank you to anyone who considers supporting us! We greatly appreciate it!
story_txt: The team at Illumination Cinema is creating a new comic book series and we are kicking things off with THE DOG PARK: Volume 1! A graphic novel containing five new stories!A single father and his absent-minded neighbor. Three young friends that are too adventurous for their own good. All of them are dogs, but it really doesn’t matter — so don’t even worry about it.  THE DOG PARK focuses on an ensemble of characters getting into absurd situations or just dealing with life’s little struggles in a grandiose way. Seriously though. There’s no bad dog puns or anything. The characters are just dogs. That’s it!In writing and in presentation, THE DOG PARK takes inspiration from cartoons of the late nineties and early two-thousands. Each story is a balancing act of goofy, over-the-top situations and genuine character interactions. The idea is that this will appeal to older kids (say, ten and older) all the way up to the adults who grew up with this style of cartoon (you know who you are).The goal of this campaign isn’t necessarily to help us make the comic itself. In fact, it’s pretty much finished. We’re currently wrapping up the last few pages and working on formatting. So what’s this all about, then?Our campaign more or less creates a way for you to pre-order the book. By doing this, we can get paperback copies not only printed for you, but also stock up for conventions and any other great avenues for selling! If you’re looking to get yourself a copy and support the artists in the best way possible, you’re in the right place!So here’s how the perks break down!Honestly, we’re takin’ pretty low risks here. I guess a printer could explode? That would be pretty bad. We’d probably get a refund and get it printed somewhere else at that point. Maybe they’ll print a spelling mistake? I dunno.As with any project like this, we plan on keeping things as straightforward, simple and transparent as possible. If anything goes wrong, you’ll be the first to know.For anyone curious about what your average DOG PARK story might be like, we have created a couple of short cartoons that will be released during this campaign and we have also made the first of the five stories featured in Volume 1 free to read on various platforms. Check it out by following the links below…VHX (Use code: FREETDP)WEBTOONTAPASGLOBAL COMIXIf you don’t have the funds to pick up a copy of the book, but still want to help, spreading the word is always good. Share our campaign on social media, share our posts, like our pages, spread the word via word of mouth. All good options.You can also check out our art streams on Twitch, where we’ll be working on the comic. Can’t go wrong with that either!TWITCH CHANNEL: https://www.twitch.tv/illuminationcinemaINSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/dogparkcomics/STUDIO INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/illuminationcinema/STUDIO FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/illuminationcinemaSTUDIO TWITTER: https://twitter.com/IlluminationCinOnce again, a sincere thank you to anyone who considers supporting us! We greatly appreciate it!

story:
If Romeo and Juliet had superpowers...

...would they choose to stay together? 

FLYING SPARKS VOLUME 3: CHOICES is the third 72-page volume to the mega-hit crowdfunded graphic novel series which has sold more than 2,000 copies! (All three volumes available as rewards)

Meta-Girl is caught in the clutches of the evil corporate goon, Peter Buxton. 

Johnny is stuck in the middle of a deadly mafia gang war. 

A secret identity is revealed -- and their lives will never be the same! 

#1 Bestselling Author Jon Del Arroz (For Steam And Country, Flying Sparks 1-2, The Ember War Graphic Novel) and artist Jethro Morales (Green Hornet, Hack/Slash, Dejah Thoris, Flying Sparks 1-2) have  another hit on their hands with Flying Sparks Volume 3! 

"Flying Sparks is "the kind of stuff that made me fall in love with early Marvel Comics"- ComicBookResources.com 

Back Volume 3 today! 

Cover art by Julius Abrera (Zenescope Ent.) and Brett R.Smith (Wolverine/Justice League/GI Joe)! 

 Variant "Pillow Fight" cover by Miss Sashi 

Who will love Flying Sparks?

Fans of the original, old school Amazing Spider-Man, Stephanie Brown Batgirl, Spider-Girl, Invincible, and other intensely personal superhero stories. 

People who love comics with deep characterization and real development.  

Readers who want fun from their comics! 

THE STORY SO FAR 

Johnny's royally screwed up his relationship with Chloe (Meta-Girl). He made a mistake, and he'll do anything to get her back, but he also has to regain control of his mafia gang's territory and assert himself as the new don. 

Meanwhile, Meta-Girl's gotten herself hip-deep into the Buxton Corporation's strange plans, finding herself captured by their narcissistic CEO, Peter Buxton. 

Will Meta-Girl make it out alive? Can Johnny win Chloe back? Can either of them get through these crises with their secret lives as powered beings intact? 

Reader Reviews of Flying Sparks Volume 1:

"It was a fun read with great art and story. I wouldn't hesitate to back it again."

"Tone is perfect, some subtlety, twists, romance, light humor, and good action. Must buy comic!"

"A fine example of a modern graphic novel, with twist after twist."

"This was a fun storyline. I like the twists. A lot of action packed into one small book!"

"If you miss comics that are full of action, wonder, and romance, pick up Flying Sparks. It's fun and engaging and will make you fall in love with comics again."

Preview Pages: 

New To Flying Sparks?

If you are new to the series, the first graphic novel (Volume 1) sets up the world where Meta-Girl is dating a criminal, Johnny Benvinuti under her secret identity. They become suspicious of each other as each of them hides their secret life from each other.

The second volume complicates the story as a mob war erupts and the stresses of both our protagonists' secret jobs tear their relationship apart.  

We have options to check out the first book at an inexpensive level, or you can dive right into this very highly regarded series and get the whole story of 220+ pages, including the Meta-Man Special side comic! 

 The Money: 

We're raising money because art is expensive and the artists need to get paid and also to cover print and production costs, as well as shipping and the fees from Kickstarter.  

STRETCH GOALS: 

$5,000 - Replace Jon Malin's art for the Volume 1 Cover.  My great friend Jon Malin recently called the cover "the biggest artistic regret of my life". I think he's being a bit too hard on himself, though with his buy schedule on Jawbreakers and Graveyard Shift at the time, it's possible he didn't put as much care into the drawing as he might have. Since we want to preserve Mr. Malin's artistic integrity, if Flying Sparks reaches the $5,000 mark, we will be replacing the volume 1 cover with a new version which will speak better to the beautiful story we have inside. 

$10,000 - We will commission a new "side comic" and all backers will receive a digital copy. This will be a full 22-page book that ties into the Flying Sparks universe. More details as they happen!

The Creative Team: 

Jon Del Arroz - Writer/Creator: "The leading Hispanic voice in science fiction," according to PJ Media, Jon Del Arroz is a #1 Bestselling and award-winning author. He has published tthree crowdfunded graphic novels in Flying Sparks vols 1-2 and The Ember War, as well as released a standalone comic, Meta-Man Special. He is a renowned science fiction, superhero, and steampunk novelist who has written 10 books to date. 

Jethro Morales - Line Artist: Jethro is a long time industry veteran who has worked with Image Comics, Dynamite Comics, and Dark Horse Comics. He's drawn for Tim Seeley's Hack/Slash, The Green Hornet, and Dejah Thoris. Jethro lives in the Philippines. 

Sanju Nivangune / Levy Ramirez Colorists: Sanju is also a long time industry veteran who has been working with Zenescope Comics for nearly a decade. Levy Ramirez has been coloring comics for over a decade as well.

Jaymes Reed - Letterer: Jayme Reed is one of the best recognized and most sought after letterers in the comic book industry, having done work for Image Comics, Aspen Comics, and many others. 

Julius Abrera - Cover Art: Julius works for Zenescope Entertainment, producing monthly books like Robyn Hood and Van Helsing. He does many interiors and has worked with amazing talent like Chuck Dixon. 

Brett R. Smith - Cover Colors: Another longtime industry veteran, Brett Smith has worked on GI Joe, Wolverine, Batman, Justice League, and Harley Quinn.

Risks and challenges

I've successfully delivered on three crowdfunds for graphic novels: Flying Sparks Volume 1, 2, and The Ember War. When this project launches, all of the art for Flying Sparks is already complete. I do not anticipate any problems. However, if there are any shipping delays or hiccups with the printer, you'll be the first to know. The book will be published by Dark Legion Comics, an imprint of Arkhaven Comics known for its dependability and for delivering dozens of quality books.

story:
This is one problem she CAN'T wash her hands of...

Not one to waste a perfectly good quarantine, out-of-work bartender CLARISSA BANKS ventures from her tiny Brooklyn apartment to the empty skyscrapers of Wall Street for a little Economic Re-Distribution.

A broad daylight heist with no security on-site...what could be easier?

But when she is surprised by an emergency board meeting, Clarissa learns EVERYTHING about the current pandemic!

Fleeing for her life, Clarissa must figure out a way to share what she has learned without being killed OR discredited.

All Clarissa wanted was a pocketful of petty cash and a few laptops to sell online. But now she's the only person who can prevent BILLIONS of regular people from suffering and dying in the impending World-Wide Economic Collapse!

 

Your World: NOW!

PANdemIC tells the story of a global threat that is hidden in plain sight!

  • Non-political
  • Written and updated as the situation evolves
  • An experiment in topical adventure fiction

 

Story by Richard C. Meyer (JAWBREAKERS, IRON SIGHTS)

Art by Renzo Rodriguez (DESOLATION WAVE)

Cover by Jason Johnson (TEAM 7)

story:
Fred Perry's Gold Digger FREDeral Reserve Collection

Fred Perry's Gold Digger is an American Manga/ comic book series that is almost on it's 275th issue! All written and drawn by one man- Fred Perry!

This is a collection of Gold Digger universe stories that were not in the original run of GD, or reprinted in the collected material. Gold Digger FREDeral Reserve brick is a 700+ page collection of great standalone and continuity pickup stories.

You don't need to know anything about Gold Digger to enjoy this collection.

Some of it is in color, most is in black and white. Lots of action, drama, romance, comedy, and more.

This collection makes a great jumping-on point for any new readers, as well as awesome reading for longtime fans.

THESE ISSUES HAVE NEVER BEEN COLLECTED INTO ONE VOLUME BEFORE.

Between its black-and-white and full-color issues, the main Gold Digger series is fast approaching the 300-issue mark and is going strong!  (Including material like that being compiled into the FREDeral Reserve, Gold Digger is already well past that milestone!)


WHO ARE WE?

JOE DUNN

If you're not familiar with us, my name is Joeming Dunn, and I run Antarctic Press, a small, independent comic company started in 1984. I have personally collected comics of almost every type and genre since 1974, and I can say that during the past 35 years, we have published some of the greatest and best independent comics out there. Our publishing history includes titles like Gold Digger and Ninja High School. The comic industry has changed over the years, so we have started this Indiegogo program to help introduce new projects from our talented group of creators.

FRED PERRY

US Marine Combat Engineer, comic creator, animator, director, game programmer, record breaker, legend.

Prominent among the many series we have published over the years is Fred Perry's ingenious title, Gold Digger, which Fred describes as a mixture of Indiana Jones and Final Fantasy. The idea for Gold Digger was first conceived during Fred's tour of duty in the first Gulf War, and it debuted in Antarctic Press's anthology comic, Mangazine, in 1991. A four-issue miniseries followed in 1992, and a regular monthly black-and-white series followed starting in 1993. The current color series began in 1999 and has continued since then. It is the second-longest-running solo-created title in the industry. Among comic books with female leads, its run is second only to Wonder Woman.  In 2013, Fred was honored at Comic Con International in San Diego, where he received an Inkpot Award for his work on Gold Digger.

(While this is Fred's comic he is not involved in the fundraiser. Making the comics is already a full time job so we handle the printing and processing of projects like this for him.)

 

THE GOLD DIGGER COLLECTION PROJECT

Over the past years, we have released other Gold Bricks as Kickstarter projects. We would like to bring more projects to Indiegogo. This Gold Brick is outside the numbering system of the main-series Bricks, so no potentially confusing volume numbers this time! If you haven't seen or read Gold Digger, this is your chance to enjoy one of the best and longest-running ongoing series in comics. Like the other Bricks, this one lets new readers join in easily, so you don't have to be shy!

100% Completed! Books already shipping!

This project was originally funded on Kickstarter in May. It's now been printed and it's on it's way to our office. It will begin shipping as soon as soon as this project ends. Please check us out on Kickstarter at the link below. We keep in constant communication with our backers. 

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1915262526...

story:
This is one problem she CAN'T wash her hands of...

Not one to waste a perfectly good quarantine, out-of-work bartender CLARISSA BANKS ventures from her tiny Brooklyn apartment to the empty skyscrapers of Wall Street for a little Economic Re-Distribution.

A broad daylight heist with no security on-site...what could be easier?

But when she is surprised by an emergency board meeting, Clarissa learns EVERYTHING about the current pandemic!

Fleeing for her life, Clarissa must figure out a way to share what she has learned without being killed OR discredited.

All Clarissa wanted was a pocketful of petty cash and a few laptops to sell online. But now she's the only person who can prevent BILLIONS of regular people from suffering and dying in the impending World-Wide Economic Collapse!

Your World: NOW!

PANdemIC tells the story of a global threat that is hidden in plain sight!

  • Non-political
  • Written and updated as the situation evolves
  • An experiment in topical adventure fiction

Story by Richard C. Meyer (JAWBREAKERS, IRON SIGHTS)

Art by Renzo Rodriguez (DESOLATION WAVE)

Cover by Jason Johnson (TEAM 7)

story:
Read the first 21 pages of Brand for FREE!

Stretch Goals Unlocked:

  1. Brand Bookmark Unlocked at $1,000
  2. Jamie Biggs Ask Me about my feminist agenda print unlocked at $5,000
  3. Brand Sticker pack by Elliot Fernandez unlocked at $10,000
  4. $15,000 Shelby Robertson Dark Santana trading card unlocked!
  5. $30,000 stretch goal The Covenant print by Caanan White unlocked
  6. $40,000 Manasseh Johnson Dawn Craven variant
  7. $50,000 American Knightmare Dark Santana print
  8. $60,000 stretch goal All books signed by Caanan White!!!
  9. $70,000 Brand vs Shinobi Sasquatch​ print by Caanan White!

 

Why is the story called Brand?

In the Bible Cain killed his brother Abel. Cain was then cursed and marked by God. The Brand in this case is the "Mark of Cain" and part of Cain's burden was to walk the earth and gather warriors to defend the world from the war that's coming. All of these warriors bare the mark of Cain which grants them abilities and protections against the supernatural.

The first set of stories center on the Craven family. Follow David Craven and his wife Dawn as they try to stop a group known as the Covenant from obtaining an artifact known as the Judas Crown.

This is tech billionaire Lionel Solomon and the Covenant who will serve as the primary villains for this first story arc. The Covenant seeks the Judas crown and wish to use it's vast power to reshape the world in their own image.

 

The being known as Santana. An agent of chaos who seeks the crown for his own sinister purposes.
 

Brand is definitely not a kids book. I'm writing for adults. We play with everything in Brand, particularly the main characters David and Dawn who are, on the surface, polar opposites. David is a nerdy conservative who falls in love with Dawn, who is more liberal and free spirited. On the surface they shouldn't work but there is love there and the relationship is founded on that. 

I created what I feel is a compelling world with an exciting and unique cast of characters. I love to write stories but comics is a new medium for me that I'm excited to enter. I've poured every spare penny I have into concept art, logos, and quality writing. I've worked with the incredibly talented Caanan White on character design and the concepts behind the Brand universe. Now that we have that, we need your help

 

We need your help!

  • I'm sure most of you know that printing isn't cheap. Brand will be a 48 page comic. We would like to publish in full color and that again is not cheap. Everybody that is working on this project are comic pros and you have to pay pros.
  • I love the look and feel of Caanan White's art. Whether it's Uber with Kieron Gillen (The Wicked + The Divine, Journey Into Mystery, Star Wars : Darth Vader), Harlem Hellfighters with World War Z author Max Brooks, or Image Comics Son of Shaolin with Jay Longino which was optioned by Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson to develop into a film project. Caanan's passion for his craft shines through and Hollywood has taken notice!

Your support now will be the foundation for the future of Brand

I want to make Brand into something that reaches the masses. TV, movies, video games. I have a series of story arcs to work on when this project is completed

  • Brand : 8 Krazy Knights
  • Brand : The Judas Crown
  • Brand : Revelations 
  • Brand : Half Daze
  • Brand : The Vow

These stories will all be out based on your support for this project. We would also like to find a good home to distribute to a wider audience so feel free to reach out if you'd like to help spread Brand to the masses.

After the campaign

I put my team together to avoid a lot of issues I see with crowdfunding; crazy delays, items not being shipped out, the money being funded and the book not coming out 2 or 3 years later leading to hundreds of angry supporters. I'm going to keep our rewards and stretch goals simple so that we can get straight to work. The money you donate will go straight into the book. 

Support Ikari Press

If you can't donate but want to help us out follow me on social media @ikaripress on Facebook,Twitter, and Instagram or purchase Ikari Press merch on Amazon Share this campaign and help get the word out!
story_txt:
Read the first 21 pages of Brand for FREE!
Stretch Goals Unlocked:

Brand Bookmark Unlocked at $1,000
Jamie Biggs Ask Me about my feminist agenda print unlocked at $5,000
Brand Sticker pack by Elliot Fernandez unlocked at $10,000
$15,000 Shelby Robertson Dark Santana trading card unlocked!
$30,000 stretch goal The Covenant print by Caanan White unlocked
$40,000 Manasseh Johnson Dawn Craven variant
$50,000 American Knightmare Dark Santana print
$60,000 stretch goal All books signed by Caanan White!!!
$70,000 Brand vs Shinobi Sasquatch​ print by Caanan White!

 
Why is the story called Brand?
In the Bible Cain killed his brother Abel. Cain was then cursed and marked by God. The Brand in this case is the "Mark of Cain" and part of Cain's burden was to walk the earth and gather warriors to defend the world from the war that's coming. All of these warriors bare the mark of Cain which grants them abilities and protections against the supernatural.

The first set of stories center on the Craven family. Follow David Craven and his wife Dawn as they try to stop a group known as the Covenant from obtaining an artifact known as the Judas Crown.

This is tech billionaire Lionel Solomon and the Covenant who will serve as the primary villains for this first story arc. The Covenant seeks the Judas crown and wish to use it's vast power to reshape the world in their own image.
 

The being known as Santana. An agent of chaos who seeks the crown for his own sinister purposes. 
Brand is definitely not a kids book. I'm writing for adults. We play with everything in Brand, particularly the main characters David and Dawn who are, on the surface, polar opposites. David is a nerdy conservative who falls in love with Dawn, who is more liberal and free spirited. On the surface they shouldn't work but there is love there and the relationship is founded on that. 

I created what I feel is a compelling world with an exciting and unique cast of characters. I love to write stories but comics is a new medium for me that I'm excited to enter. I've poured every spare penny I have into concept art, logos, and quality writing. I've worked with the incredibly talented Caanan White on character design and the concepts behind the Brand universe. Now that we have that, we need your help
 

We need your help!

I'm sure most of you know that printing isn't cheap. Brand will be a 48 page comic. We would like to publish in full color and that again is not cheap. Everybody that is working on this project are comic pros and you have to pay pros.
I love the look and feel of Caanan White's art. Whether it's Uber with Kieron Gillen (The Wicked + The Divine, Journey Into Mystery, Star Wars : Darth Vader), Harlem Hellfighters with World War Z author Max Brooks, or Image Comics Son of Shaolin with Jay Longino which was optioned by Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson to develop into a film project. Caanan's passion for his craft shines through and Hollywood has taken notice!


Your support now will be the foundation for the future of Brand
I want to make Brand into something that reaches the masses. TV, movies, video games. I have a series of story arcs to work on when this project is completed

Brand : 8 Krazy Knights
Brand : The Judas Crown
Brand : Revelations 
Brand : Half Daze
Brand : The Vow

These stories will all be out based on your support for this project. We would also like to find a good home to distribute to a wider audience so feel free to reach out if you'd like to help spread Brand to the masses.

After the campaign
I put my team together to avoid a lot of issues I see with crowdfunding; crazy delays, items not being shipped out, the money being funded and the book not coming out 2 or 3 years later leading to hundreds of angry supporters. I'm going to keep our rewards and stretch goals simple so that we can get straight to work. The money you donate will go straight into the book. 

Support Ikari Press
If you can't donate but want to help us out follow me on social media @ikaripress on Facebook,Twitter, and Instagram or purchase Ikari Press merch on Amazon Share this campaign and help get the word out!

story:
THANK-YOU!

McCandless & Company: Crime Scenes is funded. Our aim is to go to press very quickly with this project and our goal is to deliver it to you in January, one month earlier than our original February 2021 objective!

There will be regular updates as to the progress and what's coming next, so if you're a backer, please check your emails regularly.

Also, the campaign will stay in InDemand mode for at least a few days (and probably until  the comic actually goes on press), so if you'd still like to join us, please do! 

The Basics

Carey McCandless and Jessica Williams are private detectives from two very different walks of life. Each has her own strengths and weaknesses, habits, opinions, convictions, foibles, virtues, and vices. They’re also best friends. If they can’t make it together, it would be a crime.

In fact, it probably will be anyway.

  • I'm J.C. Vaughn. While I'm best known for The Overstreet Comic Book Price Guide, which I've worked on for more than 25 years, I'm also a comic book creator. I've written or co-written Stargate Atlantis, Stargate Universe, 24, Shi, Mighty Samson, Battlestar Galactica, and others. I'm also the creator of Vampire, PA, Zombie-Proof, Bedtime Stories For Impressionable Children, and McCandless & Company. 
  • McCandless & Company was one of my first creations. It's the story of Carey McCandless and Jessica Williams, two private investigators from two very different walks of life. Back when I was starting out, we did a one-shot and then a trade paperback with that one-shot, a second one-shot, and a number of short stories and pin-ups. We had lots of great contributors. The only problem was the printing was horrible. Ever since then, I've wanted to get this material back in print so that the contributors could at least say I did them justice in that sense. American Mythology published McCandless & Company: Insecurities, which was the second one-shot. Now McCandless & Company: Crime Scenes will complete the effort.
  • Our main cover is by Amanda Conner (Harley Quinn) and Jimmy Palmiotti (Painkiller Jane) with beautiful colors by Christopher Sotomayor (The Question: The Deaths of Vic Sage). 
  • Our Indiegogo Exclusive cover is by Shi: Return of the Warrior creator Billy Tucci with colors by Wes Hartman.

BONUS McCANDLESS & COMPANY GRAPHIC NOVEL

  • You can also elect to receive McCandless & Company: Insecurities - The Special Edition, the original 48-page graphic novel by J.C. Vaughn & Gene Gonzales, with a brand new card stock cover featuring art by acclaimed Bedtime Stories For Impressionable Children cover artist James Nelms! This limited edition will only be available to supporters of our McCandless & Company: Crime Scenes campaigns!

What We Need & What You Get

The work is done. We just need your help to get this project across the finish line!

  • The entire comic, with the exception of the Thank-You page, is ready to go to press from the moment we launch this campaign. 
  • The duo from McCandless & Company: Insecurities is back with some snap shots – crime scene photos? – of the earliest days of their partnership, including the decision to start their own agency (art by Gene Gonzales), an stakeout in the process of going awry (art by Harry Roland), hiring their assistant, David Bradshaw (art by Ben Dale), a heart-wrenching pivotal moment for Carey and Jessica in college (art by Chris Chua), and an in-continuity sojourn into the world of the Image Comics graphic novel The Wicked West (art by Gene Gonzales).
  • It's a great 32-page comic packed from the first page to the last with story and art!

  • Also included are character concept illustrations by acclaimed Star Wars artist Matt Busch and a pin-up by Breathtaker and Mars co-creator Mark Wheatley!

Included for the first time in any McCandless & Company comic is the story "End Credits," beautifully illustrated by Gene Gonzales, which appeared in The Wicked West 2, the sequel to the superb Image Comics graphic novel The Wicked West by Robert Tinnell, Todd Livingston, & Neil Vokes.

  • In addition to your choice of two covers for McCandless & Company: Crime Scenes, we also have number of options and add-ons from our other projects. 
  • At the top of the list, we  have a one-of-a-kind perk for one lucky supporter: Billy Tucci's original cover art for our Indiegogo Exclusive cover!

Quick Video Intro from J.C. Vaughn

 

The following Add-Ons are available in limited quantities

  • Vampire, PA signed/limited trade paperback (Billy Tucci cover)
  • Vampire, PA: Bite Out of Crime main edition (Billy Tucci cover)
  • Vampire, PA: Bite Out of Crime Indiegogo Exclusive variant (Neil Vokes cover) 
  • Zombie-Proof: Zombie Zoo Geppi's Entertainment Museum Exclusive variant
  • Antiques: The Comic Strip HC collection

New Add-On Available!

The Bedtime Stories For Impressionable Children #1 Best Comics Exclusive variant cover by James Nelms, signed by writer and former Marvel Comics Editor-in-Chief Jim Shooter, artist Joe James, and creator writer J.C. Vaughn! Originally limited to 200 copies when released, we have 15 available for McCandless & Company supporters.

More New Add-Ons!

 

Stretch Goal

If we meet our stretch goal of $2,000, we’ll include eight additional pages of stylish, character-centric pin-ups by Robert Hack, Michael Avon Oeming, John K. Snyder III and Billy Tucci, as well as Matt Busch, Gene Gonzales, and Harry Roland.

Your Impact

Your commitment to independent creators is taken seriously. You have many other choices attempting to gain your attention, and we know that.

  • This book won't get printed anytime soon without your help.
  • The Vampire, PA trade paperback and the Zombie-Proof trade paperback projects worked really well, and we're looking to repeat those successes. 
  • This is a fantastic opportunity to present a clean, beautiful edition of work that is really worthy of your attention.

Risks & Challenges

As mentioned above, aside from the Thank-You page, this book is ready to go to the printer right now. Aside from Acts of God and other such things, we're ready to roll. 

  • When funded, it will be in your hands by February (but our target is really January).
  • We have great relationships with a number of printers, so even if one or more is forced to close (that already happened to me this year), we're ready for it.

Other Ways You Can Help

With COVID-19, murder hornets, riots, talking apes with guns on horseback, and Mayor DeBlasio's horrifying efforts to bring back the Lambada, it very well might be that you'd love to support this project but can't afford to do so.

Been there, done that, friends. If you can't support it financially, please don't let that stop you from showing your support in other ways:

  • Share the link around with your friends and on social media (the impact of this is huge!).
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Join us!

story:
We reached our original goal! Thank you all who contributed and made this happen. 

 

My Story

Hi,

My name is Manuel Guzman, but my friends and family call me Lolo. I'm an Illustrator/Concept-Artist from New York City and I have always had an affinity for story telling.

Many years ago I began work on these characters and their story, but responsibilities kept me putting it off for another day. Every time I was back on the project life would throw a curve ball at me and it would have to go on the back burner again. Now, I am ready to see this thing to the end and happy that at least the extra years have taught me more about art and writing. 

Your contributions will grant me the resources to complete the remaining paintings and to print in the highest quality.

With your support I'll be able to print 500 copies of In Search of Sacha in the highest possible quality and in turn ship them out to you as soon as they are ready. Here I present you with how the funds will be used. 

 

Rewards

Wait til you see what we have in store! 

 

-Your name on the Thank You! page

-Commission me for an Original Digital Painting made to your custom specifications

-Your name on the Thank You! page

-In Search of Sacha PDF

-In Search of Sacha Printed Book

-4 Limited Edition Prints

-4 Limited Edition Large Print

-Commission me for an Original Oil Painting on Canvas made to your custom specifications

 

What are the risks?

This is a flexible campaign, so I will still be able to work with the funds provided even if we don't make the goal. I am finishing this book and if we don't make the goal you will still be getting your rewards. The problem will then be how soon. I was aiming to have the books printed and rewards ready by the Holidays. Without the resources calculated and required that date will have to be moved on to sometime next year. Hopefully, first quarter of 2020.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute to this campaign you can always help by sharing the word on social media. If you like what you see please to tell your friends and family about us and show them the video!

Thank you for your time and support and I wish you all the best!

story:
The Standard Edition of issue #2 is a 64 pg, black and white comic printed on newsprint for that nostalgic comic experience! (Rated T+)

In the last issue of BMKB...

Saaya Volkova, ramen shop waitress by day, high kicking karate girl by nature, finds herself caught within a web of deception when her uncle, Dr. Albert Vogel, is attacked by a group of armed mercenaries led by a hulking wall of muscle called Brecher.

Shot in the back, Saaya is fatally wounded. Vogel's hand is forced as he administers an experimental mutagen in an attempt to save Saaya's life. The Godhand Serum enhances the body and bestows the subject with a Vagary - a mysterious power unique to each subject. Saaya's explosive power manifests and takes out half of the facility in the process.

Coming to grips with her new body and abilities, Saaya fights to protect her uncle from the Black Sun Mercenaries and to live to see tomorrow!

The Runback Campaign

Missed our previous campaigns? The Premiere Edition books remaining from the first few campaigns are available, but supplies are limited! This is the last time these limited edition books will be available on IGG!

Gratitude

Thank you so much to everyone who backed our previous three projects and to those who can contribute to this one. None of this is possible without you, and don't let anyone tell you otherwise! It is a privilege to create entertainment for you all and Murakumo Comics strives to maintain a high level of quality in our products.

story:
TIME IS RUNNING OUT!

 

STRETCH GOAL ACHIEVED!!!

Photo by Luigi Novi

J.G. JONES PAINTS VAMPIRELLA

J.G. Jones is a legend in the comics community.  His many projects cover a wide gamut of publishers and believed characters.  From Y The Last Man (with Brian K Vaughn) to Black Widow  (with Devin K Grayson) to Marvel Boy (with Grant Morrison), his beautiful illustration has defined moments and characters across the comic book landscape.  And of course, J.G. is the co-creator of Wanted with Mark Millar.  Each of these projects left an indelible mark on all of us - the comic reading community.  And now J.G. is turning his incredible artistic talent to another icon of comics - Vampirella!

AN AMAZING HOMAGE TO THE SANJULIAN ERA OF VAMPIRELLA

J.G. was highly influenced by the masters who illustrated Vampirella in the Magazine era.  Specifically creators like Sanjulian and Jose Gonzalez were titans of illustration and their vision of the vampire from Drakulon defined the character for generations of readers and artists.  J.G. has taken that influence and created an incredible painted cover that will be at home in your collection among the other Vampirella legends!

PICK YOUR POISON - FOUR INCREDIBLE VERSIONS TO CHOOSE FROM

This incredible celebration of all things Vampirella starts with four amazing variations on J.G.'s beautiful art!  From the standard cover that captures the classic image in what easily could have been a Vampirella Magazine cover to the stark Black & White version to the unequivocal beauty of the full Virgin Art cover - any choice is perfect.  There also is a beautiful Metal Cover that shines like a newly washed fender on a classic muscle car! 

MORE THAN "JUST A COVER VARIANT" - ITS A CELEBRATION OF CLASSIC VAMPIRELLA!

A beautiful cover is one thing...but this is a full commemorative issue that celebrates the masters of Vampirella!  Inside the covers you will find gorgeous stories from Vampirella Magazine representing classic tales from legendary creative teams!  This is 32 pages of stark black & white terrifying tales from the early years of Vampirella Magazine!  That is must read Vampirella goodness right there!  

ADD PERFECTION TO YOUR COLLECTION WITH CGG GRADED EDITIONS!

Jones is a legend in the comics community.  His many projects cover a wide gamut of publishers and believed characters.  From Y The Last Man (with Brian K Vaughn) to Black Widow  (with Devin K Grayson) to Marvel Boy (with Grant Morrison), his beautiful illustration has defined moments and characters across the comic book landscape.  And of course, J.G. is the co-creator of Wanted with Mark Millar.  Each of these projects left an indelible mark on all of us - the comic reading community.  And now J.G. is turning his incredible artistic talent to another icon of comics - Vampirella!AN AMAZING HOMAGE TO THE SANJULIAN ERA OF VAMPIRELLAJ.G. was highly influenced by the masters who illustrated Vampirella in the Magazine era.  Specifically creators like Sanjulian and Jose Gonzalez were titans of illustration and their vision of the vampire from Drakulon defined the character for generations of readers and artists.  J.G. has taken that influence and created an incredible painted cover that will be at home in your collection among the other Vampirella legends!PICK YOUR POISON - FOUR INCREDIBLE VERSIONS TO CHOOSE FROMThis incredible celebration of all things Vampirella starts with four amazing variations on J.G.'s beautiful art!  From the standard cover that captures the classic image in what easily could have been a Vampirella Magazine cover to the stark Black & White version to the unequivocal beauty of the full Virgin Art cover - any choice is perfect.  There also is a beautiful Metal Cover that shines like a newly washed fender on a classic muscle car! MORE THAN "JUST A COVER VARIANT" - ITS A CELEBRATION OF CLASSIC VAMPIRELLA!A beautiful cover is one thing...but this is a full commemorative issue that celebrates the masters of Vampirella!  Inside the covers you will find gorgeous stories from Vampirella Magazine representing classic tales from legendary creative teams!  This is 32 pages of stark black & white terrifying tales from the early years of Vampirella Magazine!  That is must read Vampirella goodness right there!  ADD PERFECTION TO YOUR COLLECTION WITH CGG GRADED EDITIONS!

story:
The earth has fallen into a state of lawlessness. As chaos reigns guardian angels attempt to protect the innocent, but many times evil prevails, and the innocents pay the price. After seeing the pain and terror for many years one guardian decides to “fall” to not only protect but to make those causing the pain and suffering to pay.

 

Our story continues... The ramifications of Lilith's decision to fall begins to come to light with shocking results. Will our hero be able to over come this?

 

THERE ARE TIMES

 

 

THAT EVEN A HERO

 

 

LOOSES CONTROL

 

 

This campaign is for Book 2 of this ongoing Hero series.

 

 

 

The Funds for this project will be strictly to help offset the cost of printing the artwork is 100% complete and ready to go. With your help we will bring this new hero to life.

 

Fully Funded Goal - Lilith Logo Face Mask--------Unlocked

750.00 Stretch Goal - 3 Trading Card Set ------- Locked

 

 

 

 

 

Lilith was created by Wes Knodel with art work by Marcelo Briseno.

story:
Summary

2020 was a hard hard year. There was a point where everyone wondered how things could possibly get worse. And in too many situations, things did get worse. Some days, it felt like Pandora's Box was being played with. 

Open

Close

Open

Close

Open

And that lead to a number of us at Arledge Comics to seriously think about the myth of Pandora. Because at the very end - at the very dark bottom of that box - we know, is where hope lives. 

What's Left is filled with stories of finding light in the darkness, looking for hope in helplessness, and celebrating the smallest victories in everyday lives. 
 

The Book

  • 70 pages of B&W comics and short stories
  • Printed perfect bound at 6.75" x 10.25"


Featuring the talents of:
Michi | Jude Deluca | Harriette Chan | Rachel Jackson | Indira Dudley | Chris Lackie | Dan Gorman | Brian Dunphy | Bryn Ziegler | Eddy Hedington | Raymond Griffith | Abby Denton Morgan Rua | Julia Margarita Quiceno | JT Philips | Isabel Hatherell | Alberto Rayo | Camilo Aguirre | Patrick McEvoy | Randy Valiente
 

What We Need & What You Get

Proceeds from this campaign are going to charity! 

However, in order to send books to people, we need to print those books. Everyone involved in What's Left?  is doing so without compensation. Every writer, artist, editor - and all of us at Arledge Comics - are donating time and talent into this book. The only money not going to charity are funds allocated to print costs.

  • Our minimum goal is $400. Just enough for a moderate print run. (Technically $500 due to IGG's minimum, but that $500 goal will be our first grant!)
  • Every $100 raised over the initial goal will either fund a micro grant for creators adversely affected by the Covid pandemic or be donated to The Marsha P. Johnson Institute.
    • Excess funds (ie the 95 if we raise $1,095) will be designated for charity.
    • Looking to apply for a grant?
       

Risks & Challenges

This campaign contains minimal risks. 

  • The assets for the book are either complete or will be complete by the end of the funding period. 
  • We will be fulfilling orders via established vendor relationships - developed over a dozen successful Kickstarter campaigns.
  • In the event we don't meet our minimum goal, we will order a much smaller print run, and all excess funds will go to our designated charity.
     

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share the campaign! 
    • Even if you can't pitch in financially, a nice word in a tweet or Facebook post can go a long way in a fundraising campaign!
  • Consider joining our mailing list!
    • If you like what you see here, follow our continued comic efforts. <3

story:
Drawn by the talented Eryck Webb (Ungrounded , TnC Comics and Jumping Boy) and written by Nick Arganbright (Dribble for Kids: Lord of the Sweaters) this loving nod to the original Eastman and Laird TMNT with the love and homage to the pacing of Ultimate Spider-man by Brian Michael Bendis comes Ultimate Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles or UTMNT for short, (found over at http://www.utmnt.com)

Clocking in at 44 pages, Issue # 1 of Ultimate Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles tells the story of Michelangelo, Donatello, Leonardo and Raphael as they get more than they bargain for during a training mission in "The Forbidden Zone"; a section of the sewers that their father and Master Splinter has taught them is dangerous. What lurks in... "The Forbidden Zone"??

We did a very limited run, but would love to expand and do a second printing of UTMNT Issue # 1. Our goal is to print 50 more books!

By supporting this campaign and seeing it funded, you are seeing UTMNT to a second printing of Issue # 1 of Ultimate Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles!

If our campaign is successful we will cover Priority Shipping in the U.S. by the USPS which includes tracking and insurance.

There is a $21 shipping charge for anyone outside of the United States.

Once our campaign is successful, we simply need to send the book back to the printers! From there we can get the second printing of Issue # 1 from our hands and place them into yours!

We believe we have some decent perks too for those who can contribute but the main perk is printing the book itself! We are using the same printer as the first time, which gave us some super amazing books!  Here are some pics of the very, very limited first print run!




By helping this project become funded, you secure a print run of 50 copies of Issue # 1 of Ultimate Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.  



Want to see Eryck drawing what will be offered? Check it out:



We now have announced Stretch Goals for those who fund and support our little comic that could! Here they are below! I will note that if you have any questions on this, please comment away and I'll respond to them as soon as I can!


$675.00 -  ****UNLOCKED *** - Double Sided Cover - Your second printing of UTMNT Issue # 1 will now feature a brand spankin' new cover drawn by our artist Eryck Webb and Colored by Courtland Brugger! This cover will encompass the front and the back (kinda like the classic Eastman and Laird Mirage TMNT books)! This is exclusive just for the Second Printing Only & will delay the release of the book.


$1,200.00 -  ****LOCKED *** - Issue # 1 Is Re-lettered - The entire first issue will be re-lettered by comic book professional Adam O. Pruett (Savage Dragon, RISE, Captain Ultimate, Dark Horse Presents)! This will be exclusive just for the Second Printing Only & will delay the release of the book!


$1,450.00 -  ****LOCKED *** - UTMNT Supporter T-Shirts - Anyone who funds us and supports us with a $5 perk or above will get a cool UTMNT Shirt, with a new design by Artist Eryck Webb and Writer/Executive Producer Nick Arganbright! Adult Unisex Sizes Available from S-M-L-XL-2XL-3XL-4XL-5XL! Printing T-Shirts Will delay the release of the book!




This is my first time doing a project like this re: shipping and handling of items. Despite trying to factor in the cost of shipping in the United States (and even abroad), I am expecting a hiccup or two BUT... I have done my research and have tried to be prepared for any issues that may arise. I have also tried to assure that no one takes an overall loss, but that the project is also fully-funded. If you have any questions, please post them in the comments section and I will answer promptly!

story:
In the Post Apocalyptic Wasteland of Road Warriors, Death Cults, Vault Dwellers, Mutants, Scavengers, Warlords and Warring Tribes...

Only the Strongest, or the Craziest, survive.

This is the first issue in the V2A Wasteland Chronicles series. 

A 52 page full colour High Octane Adrenaline Blaster of a story set in the heart of the savage post-apocalyptic Wasteland.

DRONE  -  Story Creator / Writer

This is the first graphic novel I have written.  I have had this story bouncing around inside my head for many years but it was only when I met Dave West that we decided to team-up and make it into a comic book series.  I am a massive MAD MAX and 2000ad comic book fan.

My day job is running the Post Apocalyptic Industrial Rock Band V2A 

DAVE WEST - Story Creator / Writer

I've lost count of the number of comics I've written, but this one is my first set in a post apocalyptic world. I first met Drone at one of the Steampunk Asylum events in the UK and when we got talking I just knew this comic had to be done. 

I am also a fan of MAD MAX and an avid comic book reader.

I'm one of the owners of ACCENT UK comics.

PJ Holden - Lead Artist  

Legendary 2000AD artist.

Matt Soffe - Colourist 

Legendary 2000AD colourist

Gustavo Vargas - Artist / colourist 

Legendary Peruvian writer/artist/colourist (PUNO)

Ryan Brown - Cover Artist 

Legendary Marvel / DC / 2000AD / Dark Horse Cover Artist

Vlad McNeally - Cover Artist 

Legendary V2A CD artist

It follows the story of V2A.

All law and order in the world ended in an act of complete chaos.

Those that survived, true to their human natures, fought over what was left.

In the territory known to all as The Wastelands, V2A are seen as a nuisance to those trying to stamp their authority on what is left of the world. Reluctantly hired by these would be Leaders of the New World, V2A are sent out to do those things that look too dangerous, or unsavoury, for their own followers.

Scavenging and retrieving is something that V2A have proven to be very effective at. 

Passing on the things that they have retrieved to those who hired them to do so?.. well let's just say they are still working on that.

...and picking up strays, well, that's new.

The covers.

The comic has two fabulous covers:-

One by post apocalyptic rock band V2A's music CD designer Vlad McNeally.

 and one by Marvel and DC cover artist Ryan Brown

£1000 Stretch Goal - Every Backer will receive a free art card from artist Matt Soffe.

More Stretch Goals to follow.

Risks & Challenges

The comic has been completed and printed, we are just looking for support in covering costs.

story:
"Six-Gun Gorilla: Long Days of Vengeance" is the rip-snortin’, bone-crushing, brain-blasting story of a pistol-packing Gorilla and his epic quest for revenge on the cut-throats who murdered the circus owner who raised him like a son. Prepare yourself for the strangest, most startling Old West legend of them all!

144 pages of brain-blasting, bone-crunching, nerve-snapping old-school escapist Pulp adventure with heart. The art for this volume has already been completed, so delivery is guaranteed.

"Cartoonish by only a pinch, the story does a great job of walking that line of being too fantastical, yet has just enough realism to make you understand that this is a story with heft and emotion… (an) indie powerhouse of a book.” - AIN'T IT COOL NEWS

Read the entire first issue FREE to see what you're backing: https://www.dropbox.com/s/wfyxvgid1l9ej5b/Issue...

East Congo, 1849:  A baby gorilla is orphaned when a big-game hunter slaughters his entire tribe.  Placed aboard a boat to Europe, a kindly circus owner, Malloy, wins him in a card game and raises him like a son next to his daughter, Abigail, who names the tiny simian Kumba (an African word for "roar"),

Texas, 1866. Kumba has grown to maturity and become the star attraction of Professor Malloy's Traveling Circus, putting on a spectacular show as the most novel trick shot artist West of the Pecos, the Six-Gun Gorilla! Abigail and Kumba yearn to see the big cities in the East, but Malloy wants to put as much space as possible between them and the Civil War.

The war, however, comes to them in the form of Giuliano Schmidt, a Union spy wounded and on the run from hired gun Gravesend and his gang of cut-throats. When Gravesend discovers that Malloy and his circus family have been helping Schmidt, he exacts a terrible revenge. Now Kumba takes up his guns and sets out on the vengeance trail, a journey that will lead him to unexpected places, old friends and a conspiracy that could change the course of history.

144 pages of brain-blasting, bone-crunching, nerve-snapping old-school escapist Pulp adventure with heart! SIX-GUN GORILLA: LONG DAYS OF VENGEANCE is exactly what you think it is: epic gun-fights, saloon brawls, horse chases, and righteous payback. If seeing an enraged 800  pound gorilla unleashing a hailstorm of blazing death with pistols the size of Howitzer cannons gets your heart all aflutter, this is the book for you!

Let's have us a look-see at some of that sweet art by super-artist Adrián Sibar, whose stylish artwork has graced titles like Batgirl  for DC and Planet Of The Apes  and Star Wars. He has been a joy to work with, a great visual storyteller who invests every panel with style and emotion.

 

And check out this killer cover art by a variety of amazing talents:

Caanan White

Wes Huffor

Chadwick Haverland

Matt Slay

Nate Bellegarde

Oo-WEE! Tell me those ain't hotter than habanero salsa served up in an active volcano!

We at Team Six-Gun have been immensely grateful to all the people who have supported us till now - all the fine folks who have bought the book, given us their feedback at conventions, the over 2,000 people who follow us on Facebook. Now, we're looking to swell the ranks of the Six-Gun Gorilla Army. You ready to join this posse and ride with us, hoss?

One of the true unexpected pleasures of this project has been the response of the critics. I had a feeling that some of them would really get a kick out of the book, but I didn't expect this level of love:

"It don't get much better than this, Pal. A rootin--tootin' six-gun shootin', Western adventure that makes me run off at the adjectives. Wonderful stuff." - JOE R. LANSDALE (author of Bubba Ho-Tep , Hap and Leonard and Cold In July)

“...it has real weight and emotion… a well-crafted western that just happens to have a gun-toting gorilla as the main character. If you like westerns, gorillas, crazy concepts, or just plain ol’ good comics, then this is one worth checking out.” - COMIC BOOK THERAPY

“Hats off to creators Brian Christgau and Adrian Sibar (whose art on this book is just magnificent!) because they have created a very compelling world.” - CRUSTULA.COM

"Who can say no to a well-executed western starring a ferocious six-gun wielding simian? ...a really good comic-book." - THE COMIC AGE

“Christgau’s story is setting itself up to be a fantastic reimagining of a lost classic, and one worth keeping an eye on.” - SUPER ATOMICA

“Together with artist Adrian Sibar, writer Brian Christgau has revised and changed-up the classic Six-Gun Gorilla pulp tale, blending it with beloved old school western cinematic tropes that make it an ingenious cross between Clint Eastwood’s Pale Rider and a wild Twilight Zone episode.” - NERDVANA

“Read this comic book. I’m dead serious. Find it, buy it, and enjoy how Six-Gun Gorilla: Long Days of Vengeance succeeds as any good comic book should.” - COMIC BASTARDS

“…a well-crafted western that just happens to have a gun-toting gorilla as the main character. If you like westerns, gorillas, crazy concepts, or just plain ol’ good comics, then this is one worth checking out.” - COMIC BOOK THERAPY

"...a work of art that pushes the classic notions of a true western with modern ideals and updated storytelling providing a cohesive product that is a ride to read and pleasure to look at." - - PULP CULTURED

“…an indie book that deserves to play with the big boys.” - GEEKASM

The immediate goal is to publish a quality 144 page trade paperback of Vol. 1, . If you folks invest in it and get as big of a kick out of the book as I expect you will, we'll be able to do a follow up with Vol. 2 that will complete the first ten issue arc.

I'm hoping to raise $3,000 to make this book a physical reality. If the campaign makes it into the $15,000 range like I'm hoping, I'll have the funds to make Vol. 2 a reality.

We at Team Six-Gun believe in this project and its potential to blow up into something much bigger. Won't you join us on the journey?

If this thing really takes off and Six-Gun Gorilla-a-Mania goes running wild like I'm hoping it will, I see a bunch of possibilities.

$10.000 - Go hardcover with a book you will be proud to put on your shelf.

$20,000 - Include a special boxed edition with a collectible limited edition print suitable for framing.

$30,000 - Finish the last three issues and release the entire epic saga in a single 240+ page TPB.

$40,000 - Release a collectible action figure and/or sculpture to accompany the book.

$50,000 - Honestly, I can't think that far! Cross that river when I get  to it and hope it ain't crawlin' with water moccasins! (That scene in Lonesome Dove still gives me the willies!)

I've already been offered a movie deal from an established Indie animation studio, but they wanted total rights to the comic for $0.00 dollars, so I politely declined. I see animation, a retro side-scroller video game, action figures, sculptures, lunch boxes, etc., but first and foremost my greatest ambition is to make a awesome, memorable and thoroughly enjoyable comic book. Something you're not just going to read once and put on your bookshelf to collect dust, but something that you will return to again and again to revisit the characters and relive the adventure.

It's just a custom modded Gorilla Grod figure, but it gives you a good idea of the what I'd love to see adorning your shelves and kicking the crap out of your Funco Pop bobble heads.

The follow-up series, Six-Gun Gorilla: Any Gun Can Play, would be a Magnificent Seven style adventure teaming our gunslinging simian with other wild and wonderful characters from the Weird West world he inhabits.

But that's a story for another day.

To call Six-Gun Gorilla obscure is an understatement. The original story was serialized in "Wizard" magazine in 1939, with no author credited. The only reason anyone even knows about it is thanks to a 1948 book about British Pulp literature called Boys Will Be Boys. Scholars and other interested parties couldn’t help but be captivated by the author’s description of that story and so it took on a mythic, Holy Grail status the way lost films like London After Midnight often do. There are literally two copies in existence, both of which are under lock and key at a museum in England.
story_txt:
"Six-Gun Gorilla: Long Days of Vengeance" is the rip-snortin’, bone-crushing, brain-blasting story of a pistol-packing Gorilla and his epic quest for revenge on the cut-throats who murdered the circus owner who raised him like a son. Prepare yourself for the strangest, most startling Old West legend of them all!
144 pages of brain-blasting, bone-crunching, nerve-snapping old-school escapist Pulp adventure with heart. The art for this volume has already been completed, so delivery is guaranteed.
"Cartoonish by only a pinch, the story does a great job of walking that line of being too fantastical, yet has just enough realism to make you understand that this is a story with heft and emotion… (an) indie powerhouse of a book.” - AIN'T IT COOL NEWSRead the entire first issue FREE to see what you're backing: https://www.dropbox.com/s/wfyxvgid1l9ej5b/Issue...East Congo, 1849:  A baby gorilla is orphaned when a big-game hunter slaughters his entire tribe.  Placed aboard a boat to Europe, a kindly circus owner, Malloy, wins him in a card game and raises him like a son next to his daughter, Abigail, who names the tiny simian Kumba (an African word for "roar"),Texas, 1866. Kumba has grown to maturity and become the star attraction of Professor Malloy's Traveling Circus, putting on a spectacular show as the most novel trick shot artist West of the Pecos, the Six-Gun Gorilla! Abigail and Kumba yearn to see the big cities in the East, but Malloy wants to put as much space as possible between them and the Civil War.The war, however, comes to them in the form of Giuliano Schmidt, a Union spy wounded and on the run from hired gun Gravesend and his gang of cut-throats. When Gravesend discovers that Malloy and his circus family have been helping Schmidt, he exacts a terrible revenge. Now Kumba takes up his guns and sets out on the vengeance trail, a journey that will lead him to unexpected places, old friends and a conspiracy that could change the course of history.144 pages of brain-blasting, bone-crunching, nerve-snapping old-school escapist Pulp adventure with heart! SIX-GUN GORILLA: LONG DAYS OF VENGEANCE is exactly what you think it is: epic gun-fights, saloon brawls, horse chases, and righteous payback. If seeing an enraged 800  pound gorilla unleashing a hailstorm of blazing death with pistols the size of Howitzer cannons gets your heart all aflutter, this is the book for you!Let's have us a look-see at some of that sweet art by super-artist Adrián Sibar, whose stylish artwork has graced titles like Batgirl  for DC and Planet Of The Apes  and Star Wars. He has been a joy to work with, a great visual storyteller who invests every panel with style and emotion. And check out this killer cover art by a variety of amazing talents:Caanan WhiteWes HufforChadwick HaverlandMatt SlayNate BellegardeOo-WEE! Tell me those ain't hotter than habanero salsa served up in an active volcano!We at Team Six-Gun have been immensely grateful to all the people who have supported us till now - all the fine folks who have bought the book, given us their feedback at conventions, the over 2,000 people who follow us on Facebook. Now, we're looking to swell the ranks of the Six-Gun Gorilla Army. You ready to join this posse and ride with us, hoss?One of the true unexpected pleasures of this project has been the response of the critics. I had a feeling that some of them would really get a kick out of the book, but I didn't expect this level of love:"It don't get much better than this, Pal. A rootin--tootin' six-gun shootin', Western adventure that makes me run off at the adjectives. Wonderful stuff." - JOE R. LANSDALE (author of Bubba Ho-Tep , Hap and Leonard and Cold In July)“...it has real weight and emotion… a well-crafted western that just happens to have a gun-toting gorilla as the main character. If you like westerns, gorillas, crazy concepts, or just plain ol’ good comics, then this is one worth checking out.” - COMIC BOOK THERAPY“Hats off to creators Brian Christgau and Adrian Sibar (whose art on this book is just magnificent!) because they have created a very compelling world.” - CRUSTULA.COM"Who can say no to a well-executed western starring a ferocious six-gun wielding simian? ...a really good comic-book." - THE COMIC AGE“Christgau’s story is setting itself up to be a fantastic reimagining of a lost classic, and one worth keeping an eye on.” - SUPER ATOMICA“Together with artist Adrian Sibar, writer Brian Christgau has revised and changed-up the classic Six-Gun Gorilla pulp tale, blending it with beloved old school western cinematic tropes that make it an ingenious cross between Clint Eastwood’s Pale Rider and a wild Twilight Zone episode.” - NERDVANA“Read this comic book. I’m dead serious. Find it, buy it, and enjoy how Six-Gun Gorilla: Long Days of Vengeance succeeds as any good comic book should.” - COMIC BASTARDS“…a well-crafted western that just happens to have a gun-toting gorilla as the main character. If you like westerns, gorillas, crazy concepts, or just plain ol’ good comics, then this is one worth checking out.” - COMIC BOOK THERAPY"...a work of art that pushes the classic notions of a true western with modern ideals and updated storytelling providing a cohesive product that is a ride to read and pleasure to look at." - - PULP CULTURED“…an indie book that deserves to play with the big boys.” - GEEKASMThe immediate goal is to publish a quality 144 page trade paperback of Vol. 1, . If you folks invest in it and get as big of a kick out of the book as I expect you will, we'll be able to do a follow up with Vol. 2 that will complete the first ten issue arc.I'm hoping to raise $3,000 to make this book a physical reality. If the campaign makes it into the $15,000 range like I'm hoping, I'll have the funds to make Vol. 2 a reality.We at Team Six-Gun believe in this project and its potential to blow up into something much bigger. Won't you join us on the journey?If this thing really takes off and Six-Gun Gorilla-a-Mania goes running wild like I'm hoping it will, I see a bunch of possibilities.$10.000 - Go hardcover with a book you will be proud to put on your shelf.$20,000 - Include a special boxed edition with a collectible limited edition print suitable for framing.$30,000 - Finish the last three issues and release the entire epic saga in a single 240+ page TPB.$40,000 - Release a collectible action figure and/or sculpture to accompany the book.$50,000 - Honestly, I can't think that far! Cross that river when I get  to it and hope it ain't crawlin' with water moccasins! (That scene in Lonesome Dove still gives me the willies!)I've already been offered a movie deal from an established Indie animation studio, but they wanted total rights to the comic for $0.00 dollars, so I politely declined. I see animation, a retro side-scroller video game, action figures, sculptures, lunch boxes, etc., but first and foremost my greatest ambition is to make a awesome, memorable and thoroughly enjoyable comic book. Something you're not just going to read once and put on your bookshelf to collect dust, but something that you will return to again and again to revisit the characters and relive the adventure.It's just a custom modded Gorilla Grod figure, but it gives you a good idea of the what I'd love to see adorning your shelves and kicking the crap out of your Funco Pop bobble heads.The follow-up series, Six-Gun Gorilla: Any Gun Can Play, would be a Magnificent Seven style adventure teaming our gunslinging simian with other wild and wonderful characters from the Weird West world he inhabits.But that's a story for another day.To call Six-Gun Gorilla obscure is an understatement. The original story was serialized in "Wizard" magazine in 1939, with no author credited. The only reason anyone even knows about it is thanks to a 1948 book about British Pulp literature called Boys Will Be Boys. Scholars and other interested parties couldn’t help but be captivated by the author’s description of that story and so it took on a mythic, Holy Grail status the way lost films like London After Midnight often do. There are literally two copies in existence, both of which are under lock and key at a museum in England.

story:
NOW SHIPPING!!!!


 

 

 

 

Death is a moment that is coming for us all, looming just over the horizon, the march of time never to be bartered or bargained with. But in HTD, the impossible becomes possible in an instant. Death comes for the dregs of humanity, but if these listless souls have embraced the abyss of their lives and let go of everything, they will achieve God-like powers through the spark of evolution. The very qualities that dragged them down in life will become weapons to fight back death, but only if they know HOW TO DIE.

HOW TO DIE: BIRTH OF THE BLACK ICE is the 28-page first issue in a series about the horrors lurking in the dawn of man's evolution.

 

 

Man needs struggle, and if he can't find war he will shape one within himself.

HOW TO DIE is the story of superpowers and preternatual horror. If you enjoy tales of profound strangeness such as Sam Keith's The Maxx or Neil Gaiman's Sandman series, HOW TO DIE is the book to back.

HOW TO DIE is... 

Written by J.P. Plack
Drawn by Bogdan Ristea
Lettered by Federico Corsini

 

Characters

Anthony is just a boy going hunting with his father, wiping the sleep from his eyes as he climbs into his father's pickup. Stopping for a chocolate milk and a coffee. But they aren't tracking a stout buck in the dew-glistened dawn, their prey is man.  Those pathetic amongst us that dangle perilously from the lowest rungs of society.

The hunt is a lesson in thinning the herd for the benefit of man, a skill passed down from father to son, the learning of a trade weaved through the family for generations.

But this generation will bring something new, a child nurtured in unimaginable pain that rages like a soul on fire. His hunt will be like no other when he uncovers the power that lurks in the depravity of man and he is reborn as the Black Ice. 

 

Bishop’s murder draws closer like darkness swallowing the horizon. He manages a video store, screws, eats take-out and watches movies. He is treading water, going perfectly nowhere, and clinging to what can barely be called life.

He knows this, so when the hull of this lifestyle is breached by looming unemployment, he chooses to accelerate his demise, steering into failure rather than correcting its course.

For Bishop, anything would be better than to carry on like this. Little does he know that at the bottom of his descent awaits something far worse than overdue bills or even homelessness. Beyond his most terrible imaginings, his failures make him floating prey for the Black Ice, a remorseless being that skims the surface of mankind, shearing it for the betterment of the herd. His murder is coming and he will only survive if he learns how to die.

 

HOW TO DIE #1 Variant Cover

by Ralph Barrientos

 

What you're backing

This is the beginning of a wild and twisted series. It's the very first issue, the one where the creator dumps out the pieces of the universe and sets things in motion. It is heavy on characterization and motivation, with one of those final moments that sends a blood rush to the reader's head and gets them excited for the next issue.

For the reader it's also an investment, so when the next issue comes and the fanbase builds you don't need to play catch up. You'll be ready because you got in on the ground floor.

 

Thank you for your time
