story:
Saving the World Presents: Lilly & Wepwawet:

Lilly & Wepwawet is is a deluxe perfect bound graphic novel spinning off from my main series Saving the World. It is a prehistoric adventure following a 20 something bank teller on her journey through the fabric of time and space with a seemingly omnipotent being that goes by the name of Wepwawet.

Synopsis:

The Cretaceous Period is a dangerous place for pretty much anything edible, however Lilly is determined to prove that she can not only survive this brutal prehistoric land, but thrive in it. With the mysterious Wepwawet always nearby, Lilly battles prehistoric beasts, and begins to unravel a mystery that will shake the very foundation of the Saving-verse forever!

Specs:

*44 page Deluxe Graphic Novel

*Includes the two previous shorts in premium format

*Extra Saving the World short with art by Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle legend Jim Lawson!

*Beautiful pinups by the entire team at Tonic Comix including Jim Lawson, Illustrator Monk, Ryan Foust, Tony Tuthill, and Otto Arantes!

Cover by Illustrator Monk, interior art by Tonicmole


Lilly & Wep part 1, Lilly & Wep Part 2, STW: On Call Heroes with art by Jim Lawson

 

Jim Lawson:

TMNT Legend Jim Lawson joins us with a Saving the World short ”On Call Heroes” as well as providing a pinup of Lilly & Wepwawet. Jim’s influence on the comicbook industry as a whole cannot be overstated. His art graced the pages of Mirage Studios for over 20 years! If you read a TMNT comic, theres a good chance he drew it. He’ll also be returning with a full size sroty in Saving the World #3! But wait, there’s more! If we reach $3,500 combined between IGG and KS then each physical backer will recieve a signed art print by Jim Lawson! How awesome is that!?


Tonicmole:

Hey that’s me! Who am I? Where’d I come from? Well, I’m just a normal dude working 9 to 5 living in a small town in Oklahoma. I always had the dream to create comics, but life got away from me. Life has a way of doing that. I had accepted that art just wasn’t in the cards for me, until one day I looked at my scared hands, and said, “I ain’t going out like this!” This isn’t about money, popularity, or fame. It’s about fulfilling a dream that I promised my younger self. I might be a rundown old man, but that doesn’t get me off the hook. Young Tonic wanted this more then anything in the world, and I’m going to make sure it happens! What Tonic Comix has achieved is already far beyond anything he could of imagined and I have supporters like you to thank for that.

Illustrator Monk:

All I know is that he lives on top of a mountain protected by an enchanted Dragon that goes by the name Todd. Also he is one of the most talented illustrators I’ve ever seen. He effortlessly combines high technical skill, and passion to bring to life truely amazing scenes. Though he specializes in pinup and cover art, his interiors are some of the best in comics. He previously worked on Tales from the Stack, is currently working with NANCO on Rags projects as well as being an original member of Tonic Comix. I’m riding this dudes coat tails till he kicks me off.

 


Catch up Bundle:

Are you new to the Saving-verse? Well check out our Catch-up Bundle! You’ll get all four comics we’ve released up to date! (Due to low print runs I cannot gaurantee first prints of back issues.)

Our Mission:

The Saving-verse is a shared superhero universe with a twist. The twist? We ain't no giant greedy international conglomerate. Tonic Comix is dedicated to bringing intelligent alternative comic narratives into the superhero genre. We have no movie deals, and no Netflix specials. Our sole purpose is to make fun, engaging, comix for everyone! All we need to accomplish this goal is your support.

Tonic Comix began as a wild dream in February of this year and with the help of awesome folks like you we have rapidly expanded. We are ambitious, dedicated, and determined to grow into a major publisher in the upcoming years.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

This marks the 5th campaign by Tonic Comix, and we have built a reputation as one of the fastest and most reliable crowdfunding comic producers there is. As always the comic is already finished, so all we need right now is your support!

story:
SEASONS is a planned four-volume graphic novel series created and written by Nandor Fox Shaffer, with art by Anthony Gonzales-Clark, that takes place over one year of a young man’s life. With each passing season, Fletcher Hart Iiams gains a new set of incredible powers to overcome the challenges and enemies in his personal path to self-discovery and meaning. SEASONS is an intertwining, deeply symbolic, allegorical supernatural/superhero drama and character-study that explores complex themes of identity, existence, purpose, responsibility, the world within and the world around us. 

Each of the four volumes will be of the highest-quality hardcover possible and contain 100+ pages of stunningly rich black and white artwork. 

YOU CAN READ A PREVIEW OF SEASONS FOR FREE HERE!

RAISING OVER $13,000 ON KICKSTARTER, SEASONS DEBUTS ON INDIEGOGO! 

You will especially love the story and art of SEASONS if you’re fans of: 

 James O’Barr’s The Crow  

 Midnight Nation by J. Michael Stracyznski and Gary Frank  

 The Sculptor by Scott McCloud  

 Works from manga creator Takehiko Inoue (Slam Dunk, Vagabond)  

 Akira by Katsuhiro Otomo 

...and honestly if you just enjoy deeply engaging comics with a supernatural/superhero/manga bent!

PREVIEW from SEASONS Volume 1: Spring

SEASONS Volume 1: Spring includes the the first story arc of the series, with a special Foreword by the Eisner nominee and independent comics creator, Jason Brubaker (reMIND, SITHRAH, Phobos). This volume introduces us to our protagonist, Fletcher Hart Iiams, and begins the one year journey that will define him. This volume also debuts  pivotal characters in the series, supernatural entities known as the “shadow-selves” and a set of incredible, unnatural powers Fletcher himself doesn’t understand.

 

PREVIEW from SEASONS Volume 2: Summer

Waking from a prolonged coma after the shocking revelations of SEASONS Vol. 1: Spring, Fletcher Hart Iiams finds himself lost and searching for answers. Along the way, he encounters allies and adversaries that embody the forces of nature, harnessing unbelievable abilities. Abilities not unlike ones he’s manifested himself. Will Fletcher uncover the mysterious origin of his powers and why he’s caught in these extraordinary string of events, or will he remain directionless on his path to a meaningful existence? 

STRETCH GOALS! 

If we hit the following stretch goals, ALL physical reward tier backers (INCLUDING those who supported the Kickstarter campaign for SEASONS Volume 2: Summer) will be able to get in on these exciting rewards! 

UNLOCKED!

SEASONS VOLUME 2: SUMMER DELUXE HARDCOVER (SPOT GLOSS UV and EMBOSSING on the cover)! 

SIGNED SEASONS VOL. 2 ART PRINT FOR EVERY BACKER!

SEASONS DOUBLE-SIDED BOOKMARKS FOR EVERY BACKER!

 

 

SEASONS STICKER FOR EVERY BACKER!

SEASONS VOL. 1 ART PRINT FOR EVERY BACKER!

 

WHY BRING SEASONS TO INDIEGOGO?

Indiegogo has a massive indie comics community and I wanted to give everyone a chance to check out and hopefully contribute to the SEASONS series. All three of my previous Kickstarter campaigns have been successful and it seemed like a no-brainer to bring my work to this platform. This will also give us the opportunity to unlock more stretch goals, which every supporter from Kickstarter and Indiegogo can get in on! 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

This campaign is solely for the purpose to reach new audiences and unlock extra perks. Both books are a done deal; SEASONS Volume 1: Spring has already been printed and shipped and is now just waiting to get into the hands of new readers, while SEASONS Volume 2: Summer will be arriving early 2021 (April-May). That is, unless we hit the expedited shipping stretch goal! Then everyone will get their books exponentially sooner (February). 

Nandor Fox Shaffer — Creator & Writer 

Nandor Fox Shaffer grew up with superheroes, Star Wars, movies, video games, music and comic books coursing through his veins and spinning about in his imagination. Inspired by the likes of George Lucas, Jonathan Hickman, Steven Moffat, Ed Brubaker, Scott McCloud and other talents, he couldn’t resist how powerful the art of storytelling could be. At the age of 20, he published his first graphic novel, SEASONS Volume 1: Spring. Then, two years later, published Lifeline, a collaborative graphic novel project with seven artists from all over the world. He lives in Jefferson City, Missouri and plans to write and create for as long as he lives.

Anthony Gonzales-Clark — Artist 

Anthony Gonzales-Clark has worked in fast food, various department stores, back office work, was an electrician, a telemarketer, an appliance salesman, a banker, an Uber driver, now, he gets paid to draw comics. Living in Los Angeles all his life, trying to find meaning in this frantic city, ignoring the politically ignorant, seedy, laid-back academia, all he wanted to do was expand on his artistic endeavors. Self taught with no professional experience, everything he learned, he learned through action, multiple failures and mistakes. Without the support of friends and family through God, especially the awe-inspiring support his wife Karina, whom God has so fit to bless him, this path would have been impossible. Passionate about his craft, and starting to realize his potential, he is only getting more excited about the endless possibilities ahead.

Michael Stracyznski and Gary Frank   The Sculptor by Scott McCloud   Works from manga creator Takehiko Inoue (Slam Dunk, Vagabond)   Akira by Katsuhiro Otomo ...and honestly if you just enjoy deeply engaging comics with a supernatural/superhero/manga bent!PREVIEW from SEASONS Volume 1: Spring

This volume also debuts  pivotal characters in the series, supernatural entities known as the “shadow-selves” and a set of incredible, unnatural powers Fletcher himself doesn’t understand. PREVIEW from SEASONS Volume 2: Summer
Waking from a prolonged coma after the shocking revelations of SEASONS Vol. 1: Spring, Fletcher Hart Iiams finds himself lost and searching for answers. Along the way, he encounters allies and adversaries that embody the forces of nature, harnessing unbelievable abilities. Abilities not unlike ones he’s manifested himself. Will Fletcher uncover the mysterious origin of his powers and why he’s caught in these extraordinary string of events, or will he remain directionless on his path to a meaningful existence? STRETCH GOALS! If we hit the following stretch goals, ALL physical reward tier backers (INCLUDING those who supported the Kickstarter campaign for SEASONS Volume 2: Summer) will be able to get in on these exciting rewards! UNLOCKED!SEASONS VOLUME 2: SUMMER DELUXE HARDCOVER (SPOT GLOSS UV and EMBOSSING on the cover)! SIGNED SEASONS VOL. 2 ART PRINT FOR EVERY BACKER!SEASONS DOUBLE-SIDED BOOKMARKS FOR EVERY BACKER!  SEASONS STICKER FOR EVERY BACKER!SEASONS VOL. 1 ART PRINT FOR EVERY BACKER! WHY BRING SEASONS TO INDIEGOGO?Indiegogo has a massive indie comics community and I wanted to give everyone a chance to check out and hopefully contribute to the SEASONS series. All three of my previous Kickstarter campaigns have been successful and it seemed like a no-brainer to bring my work to this platform. This will also give us the opportunity to unlock more stretch goals, which every supporter from Kickstarter and Indiegogo can get in on! RISKS & CHALLENGESThis campaign is solely for the purpose to reach new audiences and unlock extra perks. Both books are a done deal; SEASONS Volume 1: Spring has already been printed and shipped and is now just waiting to get into the hands of new readers, while SEASONS Volume 2: Summer will be arriving early 2021 (April-May). That is, unless we hit the expedited shipping stretch goal! Then everyone will get their books exponentially sooner (February). Nandor Fox Shaffer — Creator & Writer Nandor Fox Shaffer grew up with superheroes, Star Wars, movies, video games, music and comic books coursing through his veins and spinning about in his imagination. Inspired by the likes of George Lucas, Jonathan Hickman, Steven Moffat, Ed Brubaker, Scott McCloud and other talents, he couldn’t resist how powerful the art of storytelling could be. At the age of 20, he published his first graphic novel, SEASONS Volume 1: Spring. Then, two years later, published Lifeline, a collaborative graphic novel project with seven artists from all over the world. He lives in Jefferson City, Missouri and plans to write and create for as long as he lives.Anthony Gonzales-Clark — Artist Anthony Gonzales-Clark has worked in fast food, various department stores, back office work, was an electrician, a telemarketer, an appliance salesman, a banker, an Uber driver, now, he gets paid to draw comics. Living in Los Angeles all his life, trying to find meaning in this frantic city, ignoring the politically ignorant, seedy, laid-back academia, all he wanted to do was expand on his artistic endeavors. Self taught with no professional experience, everything he learned, he learned through action, multiple failures and mistakes. Without the support of friends and family through God, especially the awe-inspiring support his wife Karina, whom God has so fit to bless him, this path would have been impossible. Passionate about his craft, and starting to realize his potential, he is only getting more excited about the endless possibilities ahead.

story:
Overview

MAGIC COP is a 88 (Now 92!) page fully colored Graphic Novel
Based in a world that mashes 1980s Miami Vice with the magic and monsters of Halloween Town!

ATTENTION: Physical Copies of MAGIC COP are sold out!


Front Cover: Pablo Romero

Left to right: GreyWulf Silvermoon, Iggy Cromwell, Helly Nightshade



                                                    Chapter 1 cover of 4: Brandon Diaz


Back Cover By Passion4Drawing


Introduction to Ohara the half Leprechaun half Giant

Double page spread of the Japanese District of Ambrosia

 

 

Ashcan Cover by Elliot Fernandez (Original art available for purchase)

 

Enter Bone Daddy'O, The Big Bad of The Story

 

Flash backs

Page From The Magic Cop 12 page Pilot issue, Featured in the ASHCAN

 

 



Enter Madame Sth, head of the Ambrosia prostitution ring.

 

 

All Backers will receive an Iggy Cromwell paper design so you can build your own Magic cop exclusive Block Hedz figure!

Digital backers will get the PDF. file
(blockhedz.com)

 


Every Magic Cop Needs a Slick Ride

 

 


 

 

Naughty Prints : 4 prints of the inside chapter covers uncensored. The only way to see these covers in all their glory.
Add them on to any tier at check out!

 

 


 

EP. 1 DROP DEAD LEGS

Ignatius Cromwell is a new Magic Cop straight out of the academy, with his magic wand passed down through his family. On this first case he has to learn to work with his new wolfman partner on the edge of retirement as they investigate the murder of a mermaid prostitute. With the aid of a big leprechaun and flirty witch, the team will find out that the city of Ambrosia has it's fair share of skeletons in it's closet.

Magic Cop was conceived originally as a side scrolling beat'em up arcade game but the story quickly expanded into something that needed to be told as a comic. 

Brothers Phillip and Brandon Diaz and Zaid Comics bring you a fully drawn graphic novel, with  80s colors by Eugeniu Betivu. On top of the 4 chapter, 88 paged, flashy crime fantasy, the 12 page Pilot Issue is available with the original character concepts and more in the "Behind The Scenes" nook, Cover by Elliot Fernandez.
 

Brandon and Phillip Diaz (creators of Zaid Comics and the indy comic "The Silhouette")have been working in the video game industry for years as animators and graphic artists for the largest arcade in the world. Taking this experience to turn what began as an idea for an 80s style side scrolling beat'em up arcade game into the retro graphic novel that is Magic Cop. Passion and motivation is what drive all of the projects at Zaid Comics and the outlook that Stagnant water is never refined. Zaid Comics plans to continue with the Magic Cop story after "Drop Dead Legs" and other great comic stories.

Eugeniu Betivu is a gung ho colorist who has contributed colors to a number of crowdfunded comics, such as HIRO: Blood of a Patriots, and Savior from Advent Comics. Eugene takes a different approach to ever book he is a part of, pairing the colors with the theme of the story. In Magic Cop he brings the 80s feel to the pages, blasting the coastal vibes out of the book into your eyes.

Putting our 3 heads together we are pledging to make a book filled with flashy crime, magic, and a great 80s style story for you all packed into a premium graphic novel of 88 pages. Remember we are fans just like you all, comics, 80s crime shows, monsters and magic. We can not wait to share these stories with you all!

 

100 Backers: Unlock The Ambrosia City Postcard from all of your favorite detectives, for all Physical Backers!

150 Backers: Unlock MAGIC COP THEME SONG Mp3 by Vosto Vlad for every backer!

  • 4K - HEAVY PAPER: INCREASE PAPER WEIGHT TO GIVE THE BOOK A MORE PROFESSIONAL FEEL
  • 5K - BOOK MARK: FREE MAGIC COP BOOK MARK ADDED TO EVERY PHYSICAL PURCHASE
  • WARNING ALL GOALS ARE ONLY AVAILABLE WHILE SUPPLIES LAST NOW THAT THE BOOK IS SHIPPING!
    ​

Digital Comics:  High Quality digital version of MAGIC COP in PDF format.

Signed Comic: 88+ page perfect bound, high quality printed, full colored, signed comic book.  Exploring a self contained story of MAGIC COP EP. 1

Behind The Scenes Book: Signed supplemental book "BEHIND THE SCENES" (Cover by Elliot Fernandez) including the 12 page Pilot issue "Karaoke Express" original concepts and a look into making the book. 

4 Naughty Cover Prints:  High quality prints of the 4 inside chapter covers 11x17 but these are uncensored unlike their in book versions.

Add-ons: Make sure to see what extra items we have to offer at check out! Like stickers and extra prints!

More to be added with stretch goals!

story:
SECOND STRETCH GOAL ACHIEVED!!

We did it!  With your fantastic support we unlocked the second stretch goal and are going to be able to send out digital editions of Red Sonja #1-6 to all of our backers after the program closes!  Thank you for helping us reach this milestone!

 

MORE STRETCH GOALS TO COME

---------------

 

LUCIO PARRILLO IS BACK WITH ANOTHER INCREDIBLE PAINTED LIMITED EDITION VARIANT COVER THIS TIME ON FANTASY ICON RED SONJA!

 

Lucio has wowed us with his fierce take on female characters like Vampirella and Purgatori in the past.  Now he turns his attention to the She Devil with a Sword, Red Sonja!  In this new exclusive limited edition variant, we see the violent aftermath of a battle in which she decimates the enemy berserkers and shows why she is the deadliest warrior in the land!  This amazing cover adorns a special commemorative printing of Dynamite's first Red Sonja #1 comic written by Michael Avon Oeming and Mike Carey and illustrated by Mel Rubi!

 

Three Limited Edition Variants to Choose From!

 

Pick your poison - or take all three!  The STANDARD edition features the main image with full comic book trade dress.  Our BLACK & WHITE variant shows the beautiful brushwork in a stark contrast edition.  And the VIRGIN ART edition features every detail of Lucio's incredible painting with nothing covering the glorious gory scene!  Each edition is limited to the orders for this project and will be a very rare edition.  These exclusive edition painted covers are highly desirable and will be next to impossible to get outside of this promotion.  Get your hands on some 4-color treasure with this new Lucio Parrillo painted Red Sonja edition!

 

Display the Art with Beautiful Lithographs! 

 

 

If Fine Art is your passion, add Luico's amazing image to your portfolio or display it on your wall with a LITHOGRAPH.  Available with and without artist signatures, these images are printed on the finest archival paper and will be the jewel of your art collection.  The lithograph is printed on #100 Euro Silk White paperstock at 18x24".

Graded to Perfection!

 

If you want the rarest editions professionally graded as near mint 9.8 or higher, this is your chance to add a perfect copy of an incredibly rare edition to your collection!  CGC will independently review, grade, and slab the best copies for you so there can be no doubt as to its flawlessness.  There is also a bundle option to get one of each at an incredible discounted rate.  

Frank Thorne Inspired She Devil Statue!

 

 

Inspired by fantasy illustrator Frank Thorne's iconic work on Red Sonja in the 1970s, this beautiful statue is crafted to capture the fury and majesty of one of comics greatest female warriors!  

Claim Your Gold Coins!

Each coin includes a protective case and certificate of authenticity.

Last Chance Offer!

 

A very small number of copies of Lucio's Vampirella Exclusive Limited Edition remain available.  If you missed it the first time, this may be your last chance to get a copy of the rare comic!  

 

STRETCH GOALS TO BE ANNOUNCED!

Watch this page for news on upcoming Stretch Goals!!!

 

Master Painter - Lucio Parrillo

 

Lucio Parrillo is an Italian painter who's been doing comics for Dynamite for nearly a decade and has a long list of additional comic book credits, including Marvel and DC. He's also known for illustrating for some of the gaming community's biggest names like Dungeons & Dragons, and Magic: The Gathering.

During this difficult time of quarantine, Lucio calls attention to the troubles facing the comic industry and its artists, by offering his most recent painting as a premium, collectible cover commemorating Dynamite's first Red Sonja series written by Michael Avon Oeming and Mike Carey and illustrated by Mel Rubi. 

CREATORS NEED YOUR HELP

The COVID-19 pandemic has affected the entire world in a variety of ways and the comics industry is a market that's suffering greatly right now. With comic shops forced to close their doors for safety, and their main source of distribution on hiatus, publishers and creators are feeling the strain. The passion of comic readers has always been a driving force for the comics business, but direct, online support from fans is now essential to the current state of the business, right now. If the comic industry is going to survive this pandemic, the fans will be the ones keeping creators and publishers in business!

story:
** New Final Finish-Line Stretch Goal: $3,400**

Thank you everyone for being so generous with your pledges! The Amazing Cynicalman crowdfunding campaign ends 11pm Monday night (Sept 16)! I'm going to offer one more mind-blowing incentive... if the campaign hits $3,400, I'll post a private link to this video on YouTube for Indiegogo contributors only!! 

It's a time-lapse video shot by Jim Mackey of me inking my version of Matt Madden's one-page vignette from 99 Ways To Tell A Story: Exercises In Style, where he drew the same one-page vignette in 99 different styles.... I took up the challenge and drew this stick figure version.

Now you can see it happen at super speed! Watch a half-hour job take only 3 minutes and 30 seconds! It'll be be posted on YouTube with some jazzy music for your eyes only if we hit $3,400 before Monday night!

So spread the word! Do your Christmas shopping early! Tell your favorite retailer about the 5 for $40 perk!

===========================================
Brian Eno once said, “The first Velvet Underground album only sold 10,000 copies, but everyone who bought it formed a band.”

The Amazing Cynicalman series has been sort of like that. The stick figure adventures of America’s Laid Off Superhero have inspired countless readers since 1980 to pick up a pen and attempt something they never thought possible... create their own comics.

As a weekly newspaper and web comic strip, the Amazing Cynicalman has been spread out over a wide audience. Each strip evaporates when a new one comes along to replace it. With all the strips in one book, people will have a chance to be immersed in a permanent collection that can live on for years in bookstores, libraries and ephemera shops, inspiring more cartoonists for generations to come.

The Amazing Cynicalman, Vol. 2 will be my second book of Cynicalman weeklies. The first one came out in 2003. People who were in middle school when they first saw it now have kids of their own!

The new book will be 160 pages, cover price $15, offset printed on 50-pound bright white paper, perfect bound, with a color cover, ISBN, UPC... the works! A beautiful book that will be an impressive addition to any library or bookstore... or to your own bookshelf.

This will reprint every page of the Amazing Cynicalman comic strip from the end of book one right up to the present day.

You’ll find historical oddities like my jokes about the stock market crash and the Obama election. You’ll get to see all your favorite Cynicalman supporting characters again like Stupid Boy, Antisocialman and CuteGirl...and you’ll get to meet new characters like Maw & Paw Headbanger, Ken Tucky and Marlene Brando.

To help with the printing and distribution costs I would like to raise $850 through Indiegogo. The book is all laid out and ready for the printer. I’ve met with a printer here in Michigan and have a job quote for 2000 copies. I’m putting in money from sales of the first book and I just need $850 from Indiegogo contributors to roll the presses!

For your pledge of $20, you get your choice of one the following three perks:

  • A copy of the book, signed, with a sketch on the title page, delivered to your door by a uniformed federal employee by way of our national Postal Service!

  • A color print of the cover artwork, suitable for framing, but without the logo and type so you can see all the missing pieces. And it comes with a handy character key so you can identify everybody in the picture and look for them in the book!

  • A page of Cynicalman weekly original art! These are pen & ink on bristol and come with the marker paper underdrawing and a print of the finished Photoshop piece that appeared in the paper. (Quantities are limited.)

Pick any two for $40, or get all three for $60!

Additionally, if you run a store, teach a class, or have a Christmas shopping list... you can get 5 copies of the book for a pledge of $40!

[ * STRETCH GOAL: If total pledges reach $2,450, every perk from the $20 level on up will get a bonus "Stick Figure Seurat" color print. Even if you only picked the cover print, you will end up getting BOTH prints for your $20 pledge! ]


[*NEW SUPER STRETCH GOAL: If total pledges reach $3,400, every perk of any amount will include a private link to the YouTube video inspired by Matt Madden's Exercises in Style! Check your email for Indiegogo updates! They may be routed to your spam folder so check that, too!]

Everybody who pledges any amount, $2 and up, gets a signed, highly collectible thank you card with an original Cynicalman sketch!

And as a contributor, you’ll get your name listed in the book itself on the “Thanks to our Crowd Source” page!

Last but not least, at the one-time-only, $300 level, I’ve assembled a collection of 46 first printings and early editions of Cynicalman and other Not Available minicomics going back to 1982. Some of these are the last doubles in my stash of file copies so this will be the last time a collection of this magnitude will be available in one place!

Here’s a partial list, of titles and printings. click here for a complete list :

  • Cynicalman 1–3, 5, 6, 8–13
  • CM King Size Annual #1
  • CM King Size Annual #2
  • ““Hamtramck vs. Godzilla" (CM Vol2, #1, reprints the first CM weeklies)

  • Understanding Minicomics

  • Not Available Comics 19–22 (Early CuteGirl comics:)
  • CuteGirl #1–3

  • Antisocialman #1–3, 5, 6
  • Antisocialman Annual 1

  • Stup!d Boy #1, 2, 4, 5
  • Fightin’ Guys #1, 2
  • Ant Boy! #1
  • Board of Superheros #1
  • 5 O’Clock Shadow #1

Plus I’m going to give you one last mind-blowing collectible: My original worn-out but still impressive looking Swingline SF-15 Saddle Stapler!

This was purchased in 1984 from a Raleigh, NC, office supply store and used mercilessly to assemble every minicomic I ever published from 1984 to 2008. Tens of thousands at least! Every issue of Cynicalman, every Stup!dBoy, every chapter of Death of Antisocialman, every Understanding Minicomics, the first edition of ZOT! in Dimension 10-1/2... they all bear the imprint of this rugged hunk of Made-In-USA heavy metal!

It’s got my name and my last three phone numbers written on the bottom, a tattered 1984 Cynicalman “Big Deal” sticker on the front, chipped paint and rusty metal from years of heavy use and frequent trips to comic cons in airline baggage (those were the days!), and I’ll supply a signed and stamped Letter of Authenticity for the utmost in archival sweetness. This belongs in a museum!

(Disclaimer: You have to special order staples for the SF-15 and it’s bent from years of right-handed stapling and suitcase travel so it seldom delivers satisfactory results even with the right consumables. You probably don’t want to use this thing for stapling any more.)

=============================

So that’s the pitch. I hope you’ll join me in taking this opportunity to get The Amazing Cynicalman into the hands of a new generation of Cynicalman readers. Don’t forget to use the handy Indiegogo share tools on this page to pass the word around! Tell all your friends! See you in the bookstores!

© Matt Feazell, 2013                                                                                           e-mail

strip from the end of book one right up to the present day. 
You’ll find historical oddities like my jokes about the
stock market crash and the Obama election. You’ll get to see all your favorite
Cynicalman supporting characters again like Stupid Boy, Antisocialman and
CuteGirl...and you’ll get to meet new characters like Maw & Paw Headbanger,
Ken Tucky and Marlene Brando.
To help with the printing and distribution costs I would
like to raise $850 through Indiegogo. The book is all laid out and ready for
the printer. I’ve met with a printer here in Michigan and have a job quote for
2000 copies. I’m putting in money from sales of the first book and I just need
$850 from Indiegogo contributors to roll the presses!
For your pledge of $20, you get your choice of one the
following three perks:

A copy of the book, signed, with a sketch on the title page,
delivered to your door by a uniformed federal employee by way of our national
Postal Service!


A color print of the cover artwork, suitable for framing,
but without the logo and type so you can see all the missing pieces. And it
comes with a handy character key so you can identify everybody in the picture
and look for them in the book!


A page of Cynicalman weekly original art! These are pen
& ink on bristol and come with the marker paper underdrawing and a print of
the finished Photoshop piece that appeared in the paper. (Quantities are
limited.)

Pick any two for $40, or get all three for $60! 

Additionally, if you run a store, teach a class, or have a Christmas shopping list... you can get 5 copies of the book for a pledge of
$40!
[ * STRETCH GOAL: If total pledges reach $2,450, every perk from the $20 level on up will get a bonus "Stick Figure Seurat" color print. Even if you only picked the cover print, you will end up getting BOTH prints for your $20 pledge! ][*NEW SUPER STRETCH GOAL: If total pledges reach $3,400, every perk of any amount will include a private link to the YouTube video inspired by Matt Madden's Exercises in Style! Check your email for Indiegogo updates! They may be routed to your spam folder so check that, too!]
Everybody who pledges any amount, $2 and up, gets a signed,
highly collectible thank you card with an original Cynicalman sketch!
And as a contributor, you’ll get your name listed in the
book itself on the “Thanks to our Crowd Source” page!
Last but not least, at the one-time-only, $300 level, I’ve
assembled a collection of 46 first printings and early editions of Cynicalman
and other Not Available minicomics going back to 1982. Some of these are the
last doubles in my stash of file copies so this will be the last time a
collection of this magnitude will be available in one place! 






Here’s a partial list, of titles and printings. click here for a complete list :

Cynicalman 1–3, 5, 6, 8–13 

CM King Size Annual #1
CM King Size Annual #2
““Hamtramck vs. Godzilla" (CM Vol2, #1, reprints
the first CM weeklies) 

Understanding Minicomics

Not Available Comics 19–22 (Early CuteGirl comics:)

CuteGirl #1–3

Antisocialman #1–3, 5, 6

Antisocialman Annual 1

Stup!d Boy #1, 2, 4, 5

Fightin’ Guys #1, 2

Ant Boy! #1

Board of Superheros #1

5 O’Clock Shadow #1


Plus I’m going to give you one last mind-blowing
collectible: My original worn-out but still impressive looking Swingline SF-15
Saddle Stapler! 






This was purchased in 1984 from a Raleigh, NC, office supply
store and used mercilessly to assemble every minicomic I ever published from
1984 to 2008. Tens of thousands at least! Every issue of Cynicalman, every
Stup!dBoy, every chapter of Death of Antisocialman, every Understanding
Minicomics, the first edition of ZOT! in Dimension 10-1/2... they all bear the
imprint of this rugged hunk of Made-In-USA heavy metal! 
It’s got my name and my last three phone numbers written on
the bottom, a tattered 1984 Cynicalman “Big Deal” sticker on the front, chipped
paint and rusty metal from years of heavy use and frequent trips to comic cons
in airline baggage (those were the days!), and I’ll supply a signed and stamped
Letter of Authenticity for the utmost in archival sweetness. This belongs in a
museum!
(Disclaimer: You have to special order staples for the SF-15 and it’s bent from years of right-handed stapling and suitcase travel so
it seldom delivers satisfactory results even with the right consumables. You
probably don’t want to use this thing for stapling any more.)
=============================
So
that’s the pitch. I hope you’ll join me in taking this opportunity to get The
Amazing Cynicalman into the hands of a new generation of Cynicalman readers.
Don’t forget to use the handy Indiegogo share tools on this page to pass the
word around! Tell all your friends! See you in the bookstores!© Matt Feazell, 2013                                                                                           e-mail

story:
GODS HAND is a 80pg supernatural story created by local New Orleans artist Anthony Figaro   who was the artist on the Chronicles of Count Carlos and Justice City Chronicles

OVERVIEW

Our story picks up with the Immortal Pirate Jean Lafitte, a mercenary Monster hunter who has been exiled from New Orleans because of a disastrous act simply known as the Katrina incident. He and his team of supernatural misfits are called back to New Orleans to solve the murder of his former lover Marie Laveau. As the old pirate returns to the streets of The city he once called home he soon discovers something sinister and a strange marking covering the city seems to be at the heart of it. As Jean and his team of Hunters draw closer to discovering the identity of the Killer he must confront his past and accept that he may be responsible for Marie’s death. Now Jean must answer for his sins if he is to solve the case and save Marie’s soul.

EXCLUSIVE COVER

 

This Image will be used as the Indiegogo Cover. This cover will ONLY be available through this Campaign and will not be offered to the public once this Book ships.

 

 

STANDARD COVER

 Andy Khun Cover

 

PAGES

 

PRINTS

BOOKMARKS

STRECH GOALS UNLOCKED!!!!!

TRADING CARDS

ANDY KUHN Print

GODS HAND Tarot Card

Thank to the Fans

The Team and Myself have really put a lot of time and effort into this campaign so we really appreciate everyone stopping in and helping us bring this project to life because after all we would not be here without the love and support of our family and friends 


Printing

We will be using local printers to Print the book. Overseas may be cheaper but we believe strongly in supporting local in our Community and feel their appreciation and attention to detail will produce a superior product that we can bring to everyone supporting this campaign.

 

 

About the Creator

I am Anthony Figaro, a visual artist in the Greater New Orleans area.  My art has allowed me to be a part of many things,  including working with local cities on maps, to working for Topps Trading Cards with Lucasfilm, Upper Deck and Marvel.  While art is my passion, I am first and foremost a father and a husband; of all the things I had a hand in creating, my children are my true legacy.

I've worked in New Orleans for over 15 years.  I grew up watching 80's cartoons and they had a big influence on how I developed my art into a profession. I've always appreciated the morality mixed in to the stories”. There's similarity between comic book characters and the folklore of cultures past.  These heroes are our modern day Hercules stories. These are our Jason and the Argonauts. This is our Odyssey.  I remember as a kid, I would read comics and the characters represented higher goals and higher values. They showed me what was possible and what was the most ideal about mankind.

I believe comic book artists are the divine creators of modern day mythology. With brush strokes we aim to draw hope into the minds of the men, women and children who see our work.

These days, I am hard at work bringing my newest project to life. It’s time for New Orleans to step out of the shadows and show the rest of the world the talent that the Crescent City has to offer.  My Comic Book of New Orleans is called "The God's Hand."

With the mystique of a northern Caribbean culture, above-ground cemeteries, jazz music and the tradItion of Fat Tuesday, New Orleans is one of the most unique cities in the world. For me my beloved New Orleans is an ideal setting for villains, conflict and redemption.  "The God's Hand," is a collection of characters from New Orleans' past brought into the present. The immortal Jean Lafitte and Madame Marie Laveau among others form a team of supernatural misfits to combat the evils of an ancient entity threatening to cover the world in darkness.

To bring "God's Hand" off of the pages of my sketch book into life, I need your help.  On this launch page sign up to be apart of the crowdfunding campaign. Once signed up you will receive access to special, limited items that are only available from the campaign.  Halloween is the the day  my crowdfunding kicks off!  All Hallows Eve is the day to bring my book to life. Don’t miss your opportunity to be part of  "The God's Hand."

Make an Impact! Build the FUTURE!

Funding this project will aid in the building of the entire GODS HAND Universe, an endeavor that is destined to challenge the current comic book Industry to change how we make comics for decades to come, an you can help build that future!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

If you believe in this campain, then please do whatever you can to spread the good news about what we're doing here today!

Indiegogo has 'share' tools for all your social media platforms, please hit those buttons and help bring this project and future projects to life, and help change the future of comics!!!

​​​

story:
You all know that kid, hell, you probably were that kid. You spent time in the manga section of Barnes & Noble. You knew of the only place in the city where you could get imports. You probably had a subscription to both NewType AND Shonen Jump. You may have even rented Final Fantasy: Legend of the Crystals from Blockbuster!

 

We've scoured the Earth and collected these stories of teenage animedom. So whether you live under the Tree of Might, have Moon Prism Power, fight against Talpa, or are some kind of Feudal Japanese Warrior Pizza Feline you'll read this and remember...

 

I WAS A TEENAGE ANIME

 

...

 

Our Goals (& What We're Doing with Your Money)

The biggest hurdle is funding the initial print run of the zine. We are providing contributing artists with copies to sell at cons/in their own online shops/etc.

If we exceed our funding goal, we can afford to provide the artists with more copies which will put MORE MONEY in their pockets! Isn't that great?

 

What You Get

You are important! You should get SOMETHING, right?

  • For $3 you get a PDF copy of I WAS A TEENAGE ANIME.
  • For $6 (plus the cost of shipping) you get the PDF and a real-life physical copy of I WAS A TEENAGE ANIME to have and to hold.

There are some fun bonuses, too. We might even be adding more, so stay tuned for updates.

 

When Am I Getting My Stuff?

Our comic is launching at the Small Press Expo (SPX) 2013 in mid-September. So PDF and physical copies will be delivered to coincide with that.

 

The Specs

  • 30+ black and white pages of anime nostalgia from some of your very favorite and soon-to-be favorite comic artists
  • Full-color cover painted by Brandon B. (hey, that's me!)
  • This isn't just some legal paper we're cutting in half and then folding. The final dimensions are going to be a great-looking 6"x9". Wow!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Here is the accompanying Tumblr post about the project: http://drawbrandondraw.tumblr.com/post/56533168317/the-indiegogo-is-live-click-here-to-donate-you

Reblog it, why not?

Tweet about the project! Tell everybody!

 

Contributing Artists

Kevin Czap
Jessi Zabarski
Eric Kubli
KC Green
Paul Cleland Smith
Hannah Lee Stockdale
Brandon B.
Robert Iza
Angelica Jones
MJ Robinson

We also have a few last-minute additions to the TEAM ANIME TEEN lineup:

Sarah Sobole

Lisa Grabenstetter

Victoria Grace Elliott


THANKS!

 

Find us on Twitter:

Brandon: @A_TRAGIC_GYRO

Terence: @TheBlackNerd

story:
Greetings, I'm C.Edwards and since 2005, I have created almost 600 comic strips with my popular webcomic series, "Abel Boddy" which I am currently collecting into 2 volumes.
 
"Abel Boddy" takes a comedic, slice-of-life approach to modern LGBT culture, told through the experiences of an irresponsible, hedonistic guardian angel, Abel Boddy and his perpetually, disappointed ward, Howard.
 
 
The current collection of strips will be split into two volumes:
Vol 1: "A Longtime Companion" - featuring the first 100 strips as well as pre-production work and commentary of the creation of "Abel Boddy".
Vol 2: "Low-Hanging Fruit" - collecting strips #101-500, including bonus artwork!
 
Your donations will go towards production and printing of both volumes of the "Abel Boddy" collections. The $12 & $25 levels are pre-orders, so those who generously contribute at that level will be the first to receive their copies in the entire world. Those who are generous enough to contribute at the $50 & $100 levels will receive original artwork from me made specifically for indiegogo contributors.
 
You can help me realize this dream by donating or getting the word out by passing this on to friends, family and associates.
 
Every donation counts!

story:
A new series from the creator of DEAD@17.

My name is Josh Howard and I've worked as a comics professional for 15 years now. I am probably best known for my indie action/horror series DEAD@17 published by Image Comics. My other creator owned work includes BLACK HARVEST and THE LOST BOOKS OF EVE. I've also done illustration work for DC Comics, IDW, Topps, and Mattel. 

T-BIRD & THROTTLE is the book I've dreamed of making for 20 years. It's a story about comic book heroes and villains and what defines them - and how those definitions shift with changing times. 

T-BIRD & THROTTLE is a book that has always had the odds stacked against it. The publishers that specialize in superhero books don't want new original characters, and the publishers that specialize in new original characters don't want superheroes.

That's where you come in.

Last November I funded the 1st issue (and a 16 page #0 issue) through Kickstarter. Now, I'm asking for your help to fund the production of Book #2, which picks up right after the events of Book 1. And if you missed out the first time, don't worry - I'm offering a new printing of #1 and #0 with this campaign. 

This story arc is planned to be 4 issues (not counting #0). Because of the nature of crowdfunding and the long wait between campaigns, I want to make sure you are getting your money's worth and a good chunk of story - so each of the 4 issues will be around 60 pages.

Want a small taste of T-BIRD & THROTTLE before you commit?

READ THE 16 PAGE #0 ISSUE RIGHT HERE FOR FREE

CLICK HERE TO READ THE FIRST 30 PAGES OF ISSUE #1!

CHECK OUT THE 32 PAGE SKETCH BOOK HERE!

Book 1 picks up 10 years after the events of #0 as Mitchell Maddox AKA T-Bird tries to rebuild his life and return to crime-fighting. Book 2 deals with the fallout of the events of Book 1 as Maddox comes face to face with the new heroes in town.

I need your help to continue this story.

The funds raised will go to printing and shipping costs as well as keeping the lights on while I work to complete Book 2.

I'm a one man production team. I write, pencil, ink, color, letter, and design everything myself - so it will take me a few months to complete this new issue (#1 and #0 are already finished). Right now, the plan is to deliver the completed product by February 2019 (but hopefully sooner!). 

RETAILERS! Contact me directly for special rates.

 

THE FIRST 8 PAGES FROM ISSUE #1:

STRETCH GOALS!

UNLOCKED! $18,000 - All backers (except digital) get 2 "X-Force" Tribute Trading Cards!

UNLOCKED! $20,000 -All backers (except digital) get 2 MORE Trading Cards!

$22,000 -All backers (except digital) get 2 MORE Trading Cards!

 

Risks & Challenges

I have 15 years experience creating and releasing original work. I take pride in what I do and always try to produce the best product possible. When it comes to the unpredictable nature of art & story, delays are possible, but I always deliver.

story:
World Record Comic Book Attempt

Comic Books as we know them are an American art form. In April 2011, 60 comic book creators set two world records for comic books at the Kapow! comic book convention. The first record was for the fastest time to produce a comic book. The record stands at 11 hours 19 minutes and 38 seconds. The second record was for the most contributors to a comic book.  They set the record with 60 contributors. 7 months later in Argentina, the record for most contributors was broken with 81 different people contributing to a published comic.

On January 25th, 2014 at Amazing Arizona Comicon, we plan to bring both records back to the country that originated the modern day comic book.

We are raising the bar.

  • 101 Artists.
  • 12 Writers
  • 25 pages
  • Produced in less than 11 hours
  • Copies of the finished comic book will be available on Sunday at the convention. 
  • A majority of the proceedings from the sale of the comic donated to the Hero Initiative.
Help us make history.

What We Need & What You Get

The Guinness Book of World Records requires that we print and sell at least 400 copies of the published book.  We know that not everyone can attend the convention Sunday to purchase a copy, so we decided to make the copies available through the Indiegogo campaign.  The first book will be a Guinness Book of World Records attempt book.  It costs $20k to get a representative from Guinness to fly out and certify the record on-site, so instead we are collecting all the evidence and mailing it off the Guinness to validate the record.  The verification and certification of the record can take up to 12 weeks.  We are printing 500 World Record attempt comics available Sunday.  After we certify that the record has been broken, we will ship out a World Record holder copy with a cover that has pictures of all the people who helped break the record.

We want to get as much money to the Hero Initiative, a non-profit organization that help comic book creators who have a financial or medical hardship.  We are asking people to pledge toward the campaign which helps offset the costs of printing and licensing the Guinness Book of World Records logo for the record holder version of the comic.  Everything beyond that goes to the Hero Initiative.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate your support.  Not everyone is able to pledge to our campaign, but you can get the word out about what we attempting to do.  Thanks for your support.

Confirmed Comic Book Creators

  • Kyle Higgins (Nightwing)
  • Brian Buccellato (Flash, Foster)
  • Dan Wickline (Grimm Fairy Tales, Bleedingcool.com)
  • Ken Kristensen (Todd the Ugliest Kid on Earth)
  • Tony Parker (Mass Effect, Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep)
  • Mike DeBalfo (Fathom)
  • Jason Pedersen (Zombies vs Cheerleaders)
  • Eric Mengel (Ocho)
  • Andy Bohn (Elvatron)
  • Al Sparrow (Thugs)
  • Ross Demma (Christmas Fire)
story_txt:
World Record Comic Book AttemptComic Books as we know them are an American art form. In April 2011, 60 comic book creators set two world records for comic books at the Kapow! comic book convention. The first record was for the fastest time to produce a comic book. The record stands at 11 hours 19 minutes and 38 seconds. The second record was for the most contributors to a comic book.  They set the record with 60 contributors. 7 months later in Argentina, the record for most contributors was broken with 81 different people contributing to a published comic.On January 25th, 2014 at Amazing Arizona Comicon, we plan to bring both records back to the country that originated the modern day comic book.We are raising the bar.
101 Artists.
12 Writers
25 pages
Produced in less than 11 hours
Copies of the finished comic book will be available on Sunday at the convention. 
A majority of the proceedings from the sale of the comic donated to the Hero Initiative.
Help us make history.What We Need & What You GetThe Guinness Book of World Records requires that we print and sell at least 400 copies of the published book.  We know that not everyone can attend the convention Sunday to purchase a copy, so we decided to make the copies available through the Indiegogo campaign.  The first book will be a Guinness Book of World Records attempt book.  It costs $20k to get a representative from Guinness to fly out and certify the record on-site, so instead we are collecting all the evidence and mailing it off the Guinness to validate the record.  The verification and certification of the record can take up to 12 weeks.  We are printing 500 World Record attempt comics available Sunday.  After we certify that the record has been broken, we will ship out a World Record holder copy with a cover that has pictures of all the people who helped break the record.We want to get as much money to the Hero Initiative, a non-profit organization that help comic book creators who have a financial or medical hardship.  We are asking people to pledge toward the campaign which helps offset the costs of printing and licensing the Guinness Book of World Records logo for the record holder version of the comic.  Everything beyond that goes to the Hero Initiative.Other Ways You Can HelpWe appreciate your support.  Not everyone is able to pledge to our campaign, but you can get the word out about what we attempting to do.  Thanks for your support.Confirmed Comic Book Creators

Kyle Higgins (Nightwing)

Brian Buccellato (Flash, Foster)
Dan Wickline (Grimm Fairy Tales, Bleedingcool.com)
Ken Kristensen (Todd the Ugliest Kid on Earth)
Tony Parker (Mass Effect, Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep)
Mike DeBalfo (Fathom)
Jason Pedersen (Zombies vs Cheerleaders)
Eric Mengel (Ocho)
Andy Bohn (Elvatron)
Al Sparrow (Thugs)
Ross Demma (Christmas Fire)
